english_source: Forbes continued his success by releasing studio albums including Levels (2014), a collaborative album with Anatii titled Be Careful What You Wish For (2017), Touch My Blood (2018) and his final album, Mass Country (2023).
target1_text: UForbes waqhubeka nempumelelo yakhe ngokukhipha ama-albhamu enziwa e-studio afaka i-Levels (2014), i-albhamu ayenza ngokubambisana no-Anatii[1] enesihloko esithi Be Careful What You Wish For (2017), Touch My Blood (2018) ne-albhamu yakhe yokugcina, i-Mass Country (2023).
target2_text: UForbes waqhubeka nempumelelo yakhe ngokukhipha ama-albhamu e-studio ahlanganisa i-Levels (2014), i-albhamu yokubambisana no-Anatii enesihloko esithi Be Careful What You Wish For (2017), Touch My Blood (2018) ne-albhamu yakhe yokugcina, i-Mass Country (2023).

english_source: The history of the library can be traced back to the establishment of the Book Society of Pietermaritzburg[4] in 1846, supported by David Dale Buchanan, editor of the local newspaper, the Natal Witness.[5] It had a reading room and a small library and opened as Pietermaritzburg's first public library in 1849. It initially struggled, but was later supported by the Natal Society (launched in 1851) which, by 1865, had absorbed the Book Society and started to raise funds for a permanent location. For 2,000 guineas, the Society bought 20 Longmarket Street in 1876; it opened as a public library and museum in February 1878.[3]
target1_text: Umlando womtapo wezincwadi ungahlehliselwa emuva ekumisweni kwe-Book Society of Pietermaritzburg[1] ngo-1846, esekelwa nguDavid Dale Buchanan, umhleli wephephandaba lendawo, i-Natal Witness.[2] Yayinegumbi lokufunda nomtapo wezincwadi omncane futhi yavulwa njengomtapo wezenhlalo wokuqala wasePietermaritzburg ngo-1849. Ekuqaleni yayilwela, kodwa kamuva yasekelwa yi-Natal Society (eyasungulwa ngo-1851) eyayithathe i-Book Society ngo-1865, futhi yaqala ukuqoqa izimali zendawo ehlala njalo. Nge-guineas ezingu-2,000, iNhlangano yathenga i-20 Longmarket Street ngo-1876; yavulwa njengomtapo wezincwadi womphakathi nomnyuziyamu ngoFebruary 1878.[3]
target2_text: Umlando womtapo wezincwadi ungahlehliselwa emuva ekumisweni kwe-Book Society of Pietermaritzburg[1] ngo-1846, esekelwa nguDavid Dale Buchanan, umhleli wephephandaba lendawo, i-Natal Witness.[2] Yayinegumbi lokufunda nomtapo wezincwadi omncane futhi yavulwa njengomtapo wezenhlalo wokuqala wasePietermaritzburg ngo-1849. Ekuqaleni kwakunzima, kodwa kamuva yasekelwa yi-Natal Society (eyasungulwa ngo-1851) eyayithathe i-Book Society ngo-1865, futhi yaqala ukuqoqa izimali zendawo ekuyo. Nge-guineas ezingu-2,000, iNhlangano yathenga i-20 Longmarket Street ngo-1876; yavulwa njengomtapo wezincwadi womphakathi nomnyuziyamu ngoFebruary 1878.[3]

english_source: In 1916, the Natal Society Library was granted legal deposit status. With every book published in South Africa now held in the library for copyright and archival purposes, it had to be repeatedly expanded. New Longmarket Street buildings were added in 1929 and 1957, and a building in Commercial Road was leased from 1963.[1]
target1_text: Ngo-1916, Umtapo Wezincwadi WaseNatal wanikezwa isikhundla sokugcina ucwaningo ngokusemthethweni. Njengoba zonke izincwadi ezikhishwe INingizimu Afrika manje zigcinwe emtatsheni wezincwadi ngezinhloso zokubhalisa, kwadingeka ukuthi zandiswa ngokuphindaphindiwe. Izakhiwo ezintsha zeLongmarket Street zenezelwa ngo-1929 nango-1957, futhi isakhiwo seCommercial Road saqashwa kusukela ngo-1963.[1]
target2_text: Ngo-1916, Umtapo Wezincwadi WaseNatal wanikezwa isikhundla sokugcina imali esingokomthetho. Njengoba zonke izincwadi ezinyatheliswe INingizimu Afrika manje zigcinwe emtatsheni wezincwadi ngezinhloso zokubhalisa, kwadingeka ukuthi zandiswa ngokuphindaphindiwe. Izakhiwo ezintsha zeLongmarket Street zenezelwa ngo-1929 nango-1957, futhi isakhiwo seCommercial Road saqashwa kusukela ngo-1963.[1]

english_source: In 2022, The Natal Piano Movement's gqom album, The Legendary Edition was a fusion of gqom, deep house and amapiano.[71]
target1_text: Ngo-2022, i-albhamu ye-Igqom ye-Natal Piano Movement, i-Legendary Edition yayihlanganisa izinzuzo zezigqom, i-Deep House, kanye ne-Amapiano.[1]
target2_text: Ngo-2022, i-albhamu ye-Igombo ye-Natal Piano Movement, i-Legendary Edition yayiyinhlanganisela ye-Igbo, i-Deep House ne-Amapiano.[1]

english_source: Gwara gwara is performed by rolling and swinging the arm and the elbow in terms of making a circle, and one of the leg moves in connection with the arm's rhythm. It appears to have some similarities to the stanky legg.[98] Gwara gwara[99] was made famous by South Africans DJ Bongz and musician Babes Wodumo.[100][4] The dance move was created by disc jockey and producer DJ Bongz, it was heavily imitated by South Africans and other African people mainly during 2016.[101][102] It also received widespread popularization globally as the choreography was adopted by notable musicians: Rihanna performed the dance move while performing "Wild Thoughts" at the 60th Annual Grammy Awards in 2018. Childish Gambino performed the dance in the video of his song "This Is America".[103] BTS performed the dance in the choreography for their song "Idol".[8]
target1_text: I-IGwara gwara iyenzwa ngokugingqa nokushaya ingalo nendololwane ngokwenza isiyingi, futhi omunye wemilenze uhamba ngokuhambisana nesigqi sengalo. Kubonakala sengathi iyafana ne-i-stanky legg. UGwara gwara waduma nge-DJ Bongz IGwara gwara Afrika kanye nomculi uBabes Wodumo. Isinyathelo sokudansa sasungulwa ngumdlali we-disc kanye nomkhiqizi uDJ Bongz, salingiswa kakhulu abantu baseNingizimu Afrika nabanye abantu base-Afrika ikakhulukazi phakathi no-2016. Iphinde yathola ukuthandwa kabanzi emhlabeni wonke njengoba i-choreography yamukelwa abaculi abavelele: URihanna wenza isinyathelo sokudansa ngenkathi edlala i-"Wild Thoughts" kuma-60th Annual Grammy Awards ngo-2018. UChildish Gambino wenza umdanso ku-video yengoma yakhe ethi "This Is America". I-BTS yenza umdanso emdlalweni wengoma yabo ethi "Idol".[1][2][3]
target2_text: I-IGwara gwara yenziwa ngokugingqa nokushaya ingalo nendololwane ngokwenza isiyingi, futhi omunye wemilenze uhamba ngokuhambisana nesigqi sengalo. Kubonakala sengathi iyafana ne-i-stanky legg.[1] UGwara gwara[2] waduma nge-DJ BIGwara gwara Afrika kanye nomculi uBabes Wodumo.[3][4] Isinyathelo sokudansa sasungulwa ngumdlali we-disc kanye nomkhiqizi uDJ Bongz, salingiswa kakhulu abantu baseNingizimu Afrika nabanye abantu base-Afrika ikakhulukazi phakathi no-2016.[5][6] Iphinde yathola ukuthandwa kabanzi emhlabeni wonke njengoba i-choreography yamukelwa abaculi abavelele: URihanna wenza isinyathelo sokudansa ngenkathi edlala i-"Wild Thoughts" kuma-60th Annual Grammy Awards ngo-2018. UChildish Gambino wenza umdanso ku-video yengoma yakhe ethi "This Is America".[7] I-BTS yenza umdanso emdlalweni wengoma yabo ethi "Idol".[8]

english_source: Arda Güler (Turkish pronunciation: [aɾˈda ˈɟylæɾ] ⓘ; born 25 February 2005) is a Turkish professional footballer who plays as an attacking midfielder or winger[2] for La Liga club Real Madrid and the Turkey national team.
target1_text: U-Arda Güler (   [aɾˈda ˈɟylæɾ] i; owazalwa ngo-25 February 2005) ungumdlali webhola likanobhutshuzwayo waseTurkey odlala njengomdlali ohlaselayo ophakathi nendawo noma i-winger[1] weqembu le-La Liga I-Real Madrid Iqembu lesizwe laseTurkey.
target2_text: U-Arda Güler (owazalwa ngo-25 February 2005) ungumdlali webhola likanobhutshuzwayo waseTurkey odlala njengomdlali ohlaselayo ophakathi nendawo noma i-winger[1] weqembu le-La Liga I-Real Madrid Iqembu lesizwe laseTurkey.

english_source: Güler signed a two-and-a-half-year-long professional contract with Fenerbahçe, on 13 January 2021.[4] He was considered as a wonderkid and seen as a big prospect for the future.[5]
target1_text: UUGüler wasayina inkontileka yobungcweti yeminyaka emibili nengxenye ne-Fenerbahçe ngo-13 January 2021.[1] Wayebhekwa njengomntwana onethalente elihle futhi wayethathwa njengethemba elikhulu lekusasa.[2]
target2_text: UGüler wasayina inkontileka yobungcweti yeminyaka emibili nengxenye ne-I-Fenerbahçe, ngo-13 January 2021.[1] Wayebhekwa njengomntwana omangalisayo futhi wayebhekwa njengethemba elikhulu lesikhathi esizayo.[2]

english_source: Berenguer began his career at Osasuna in 2014, and played in Italy with Torino for three seasons before joining Athletic in 2020.

target2_text: UBerenguer waqala umsebenzi wakhe e-I-Osasuna ngo-2014, futhi wadlala e-Italy ne-ITorino izinkathi ezintathu ngaphambi kokujoyina i-Athletic ngo-2020.

english_source: Liam Scales (born 8 August 1998) is an Irish professional footballer who plays as a centre-back or a left-back for Scottish Premiership club Celtic and the Republic of Ireland national team.

english_source: Scales is from Barndarrig, County Wicklow.[2] He studied Irish and geography at University College Dublin.[2] He is a fluent Irish speaker.[3]

target2_text: I-Scales ivela I-Barndarrig, I-County Wicklow.[1] Wafunda isi-Ireland kanye nokuma kwezwe e-University College Dublin.[1] Uyisikhulumi sase-Ireland esikhukhumele kahle.[2]

english_source: Johnston accepted an invitation to the Canada national team camp in January 2021.[30] He made his debut for Canada on March 25, 2021, as a 69th-minute substitute against Bermuda in the first round of 2022 World Cup qualifying,[31] and scored his first goal for Canada in the following match against the Cayman Islands.[32] In June 2021 Johnston was named to the 60-man preliminary squad for the 2021 CONCACAF Gold Cup,[33] and on July 1 he was named to the final squad.[34]
target1_text: UJohnston wamukela isimemo sekamu Iqembu lesizwe laseCanada ngoJanuwari 2021.[1] Wenza i-Canada yakhe yokuqala ngoMashi 25, 2021, njengomdlali we-69th-minute we-IBermuda emdlalweni wokuqala we-World Cup qualifying ye-2022, futhi wafaka igoli lakhe lokuqala le-Canada emdlalwa olandelayo we-Cayman Islands.[2][3] NgoJuni 2021 uJohnston waqokwa eqenjini lamadoda angu-60 le-CONCACAF Gold Cup ka-2021, futhi ngoJulayi 1 waqokwa ecenjini lokugcina.[4][5]

NgoJuni 2021 uJohnston waqokwa eqenjini lamadoda angu-60 le-CONCACAF Gold Cup ka-2021, futhi ngoJulayi 1 waqokwa ecenjini lokugcina.

english_source: Empangeni is home to a number of faiths, including Christian, Muslim, and Jehovah's Witness. Christianity and the Nazareth Baptist church are the dominant faith in Empangeni with a large number or operating church, amongst them are Christian Family Church, The Redeemed Christian Church of God, Empangeni Methodist Church, AGS Empangeni, Victory Family Church, Full Gospel Church, Lutheran Church, Solid Ground Church, Empangeni Baptist Church, Uniting Reformed Church (Dutch), the Catholic Church, The Methodist Church ,Holy cross and St Thomas in Felixton
target1_text: I-Mangweni iyikhaya lezinkolelo eziningi ezehlukene, kuhlanganisa eyobuKristu, amaSulumane, noFakazi BakaJehova. UbuKristu nesonto lama-Baptist laseNazaretha bayinkolo evelele e-Mangweni enenani elikhulu noma isonto elisebenza, phakathi kwabo kukhona iSonto Lomndeni WamaKristu, iSonto LaseMethodist Lase-eMpangeni, iSonto Lomkhaya Wase-Victory, iSonto LeVangeli Eliphelele, iSonto LamaLuthela, iSonto Eliqinile, iSonto lamaBaptist, iSonto Lokuhlangana (Luthela LaseDashi), iSonto LamaWeseli, iSonto Lemodisi, iSonto Lasethodisi, Isiphambano Elingcwele neSonto LaseFelixton.

english_source: It is also home of prominent influential people,the likes of Minister of Water and Sanitation Senzo Mchunu, Former Minister of Labour Mildred Oliphant, the late former Chairman of Eskom Ben Ngubane, Actress and film director Wendy Gumede, International Actor Mthandeni Mbambo, International Artist Muzi, Social Activists Wiwi Gumede, Mthobisi Mtshali and Social Entrepreneur Mpendulo Mbulawa.
target1_text: Iphinde ibe yikhaya labantu abavelele abanethonya, njengoNgqongqoshe Wamanzi Nokukhucululwa Kwezimangalo uSenzo Mchunu, OwayenguNgqongqoshi Wezemisebenzi uMildred Oliphant, Owayengusi owayengusihlalo we-Eskom Ben Ngubane, Umlingisi nomqondisi wamafilimu uWendy Gumede, Umlingiswa Wamazwe Omhlaba uMthandeni Mbambo, Abashisekeli Wezenhlalakahle uWiwi Gumede, uMthobisi Mtshali kanye noMsculabulawa.

english_source: Buthelezi was one of the most prominent black politicians of the apartheid era. He was the sole political leader of the KwaZulu government, entering when it was still the native reserve of Zululand in 1970 and remaining in office until it was abolished in 1994. Critics described his administration as a de facto one-party state, intolerant of political opposition and dominated by Inkatha (now the IFP), Buthelezi's political movement.
target1_text: UButhelezi wayengomunye wabezombusazwe abansundu abavelele kakhulu Inkathi yobandlululo. Wayengumholi wezombusazwe kuphela kahulumeni waseKwaZulu, wangena ngenkathi useyisiqiwu somdabu saseZululand ngo-1970 futhi wahlala esikhundleni kwaze kwaba yilapho uqedwa ngo-1994. Abagxeki bachaza ukuphatha kwakhe njengombuso weqembu elilodwa, ongeke ubekezelele ukuphikiswa kwezombusazwe futhi obuswa yi-Inkatha (manje eyi-IFP), inhlangano yezombusazwe kaButhelezi.
target2_text: UButhelezi wayengomunye wabezombusazwe abansundu abavelela kakhulu ngenkathi yobandlululo. Wayengumholi wezombusazwe kuphela kahulumeni waKwaZulu, wangena ngenkathi useyisiqiwu somdabu saseZululand ngo-1970 futhi wahlala esikhundleni kwaze kwaba yilapho uqedwa ngo-1994. Abagxeki bachaza ukuphatha kwakhe njengombuso weqembu elilodwa, ongeke ubekezelele ukuphikiswa kwezombusazwe futhi obuswa yi-Inkatha (manje eyi-IFP), inhlangano yezombusazwe eyavuselelwa uButhelezi.[1]

english_source: Buthelezi's role during the final decades of apartheid is controversial, and the Truth and Reconciliation Commission found that the IFP under Buthelezi's leadership "was the primary non-state perpetrator" of violence during the apartheid era and named him as "a major perpetrator of violence and human rights abuses".[1]
target1_text: Iqhaza likaButhelezi phakathi namashumi eminyaka okugcina ombuso wobandlululo laba yimpikiswano, futhi i-Truth and Reconciliation Commission yathola ukuthi i-IFP ngaphansi kobuholi bukaButhelezi "yayingumgqugquzeli oyinhloko ongeyena ohulumeni" wobudlova ngesikhathi sobandlululo futhi yambiza ngokuthi "umgqugquzeli omkhulu wodlame nokuhlukunyezwa kwamalungelo abantu".[1]
target2_text: Indima kaButhelezi phakathi namashumi eminyaka okugcina wobandlululo iyimpikiswano, futhi i-Truth and Reconciliation Commission yathola ukuthi i-IFP ngaphansi kobuholi bukaButhelezi "yayingumgqugquzeli oyinhloko ongeyena ohulumeni" wobudlova ngesikhathi sobandlululo futhi yambiza ngokuthi "umgqugqugquli omkhulu wobudlova nokuhlukunyezwa kwamalungelo abantu".[1]

english_source: I was taught by Professor ZK Matthews, I knew Dr John Langalibalele Dube, I was mentored by Inkosi Albert Luthuli, and I worked closely with Mr Oliver Tambo and Mr Nelson Mandela. My personal history cannot be extricated from the history of the liberation struggle, or from that of the African National Congress.[15]
target1_text: Ngafundiswa uSolwazi ZK Matthews, ngangimazi uDkt. John Langalibalele Dube, ngangiholwa Inkosi Albert Luthuli, futhi ngangisebenzisana kakhulu noMnu Oliver Tambo noMnu Nelson Mandela. Umlando wami wangempela awukwazi ukususwa emlandweni womzabalazo wenkululeko, noma we-African National Congress.[1]

english_source: Gert-Johan Coetzee (born 18 November 1987), is a South African fashion artist. His fashion atelier is based in Linden, Johannesburg in Gauteng province. He specialises in couture red carpet gowns, he also designs ready-to-wear range . Coetzee is known for dressing South African and international celebrities at red-carpet events.[1]
target1_text: UGert-Johan Coetzee (owazalwa ngo-18 uNobemba 1987), ungumdwebi wemfashini waseNingizimu Afrika. I-atelier yakhe yemfashini isendaweni yaseLinden, IGoli esifundazweni saseGauteng. Usebenza kakhulu ngezingubo zokugqoka ezibomvu, uphinde aklame uhlu lwe ukulungele ukugqoka. UCoetzee waziwa ngokugqoka osaziwayo baseNingizimu Afrika nabamazwe omhlaba emicimbini yokhaphethi obomvu.[1]

Usebenza kakhulu ngezingubo zokugqoka ezibomvu, uphinde aklame uhlu lwe-ready-to-wear. UCoetzee waziwa ngokugqoka osaziwayo baseNingizimu Afrika nabamazwe omhlaba emicimbini yokhaphethi obomvu.[1]

english_source: A healthy diet is a diet that maintains or improves overall health. A healthy diet provides the body with essential nutrition: fluid, macronutrients such as protein, micronutrients such as vitamins, and adequate fibre and food energy.[2][3]
target1_text: ukudla okunempilo ukudla okulondoloza noma ukuthuthukisa impilo ephelele. Ukudla okunempilo kunikeza umzimba ukudla okubalulekile: uketshezi, ama-macronutrients afana namaprotheni, ama-micronutrients afana namavithamini, kanye ne-fiber eyanele nAmandla okudla.[1][2]
target2_text: Ukudla okunempilo ukudla okuthuthukisa impilo yomuntu womke. Ukudla okunempilo kunikeza umzimba ukudla okubalulekile: uketshezi, ama-macronutrients afana namaprotheni, ama-micronutrients afana namavithamini, kanye ne-fiber eyanele amandla okudla.[1][2]

english_source: A healthy diet may contain fruits, vegetables, and whole grains, and may include little to no ultra-processed foods or sweetened beverages. The requirements for a healthy diet can be met from a variety of plant-based and animal-based foods, although additional sources of vitamin B12 are needed for those following a vegan diet.[4] Various nutrition guides are published by medical and governmental institutions to educate individuals on what they should be eating to be healthy. Nutrition facts labels are also mandatory in some countries to allow consumers to choose between foods based on the components relevant to health.[5][6]
target1_text: Ukudla okunempilo kungahlanganisa izithelo, imifino, kanye nokudla okusanhlamvu okuphelele, futhi kungahlanganisa okuncane noma okungekho ukudla okwenziwa nge-ultra-process noma iziphuzo ezinoshukela. Izidingo zokudla okunempilo zingahlanganyelwa ngokudla okuhlukahlukene okusekelwe ezitshalweni nasezilwaneni, yize imithombo eyengeziwe ivithamini B12 idingekile kulabo abalandela ukudla okuyi-vegan.[1] Iziqondiso ezahlukahlukene zokudla zinyatheliswa yizikhungo zezokwelapha nezikahulumeni ukufundisa abantu ukuthi kufanele badle kanjani ukuze babe nemphilo. Amalebula amaqiniso okudla nawo ayimfuneko kwamanye amazwe ukuvumela abathengi ukuba bakhethe phakathi kokudla okusekelwe ezakhi ezihlobene nempilo.[2][3]
target2_text: Ukudla okunempilo kungahlanganisa izithelo, imifino, kanye nokusanhlamvu okuphelele, futhi kungahlanganisa okuncane noma okungekho ukudla okwenziwa nge-ultra-process noma iziphuzo ezinoshukela. Izidingo zokudla okunempilo zingahlanganyelwa ngokudla okuhlukahlukene okusekelwe ezitshalweni nasezilwaneni, yize imithombo eyengeziwe Ivithamini B12 idingekile kulabo abalandela ukudla okuyi-vegan.[1] Iziqondiso ezahlukahlukene zokudla zinyatheliswa yizikhungo zezokwelapha nezikahulumeni ukufundisa abantu ukuthi kufanele badle kanjani ukuze babe nemphilo. Amalebula amaqiniso okudla nawo ayimfuneko kwamanye amazwe ukuvumela abathengi ukuba bakhethe phakathi kokudla okusekelwe ezakhi ezihlobene nempilo.[2][3]

english_source: The North-West University (NWU) is a public research university located on three campuses in Potchefstroom, Mahikeng and Vanderbijlpark in South Africa. The university came into existence through the merger in 2004 of the Potchefstroom University for Christian Higher Education, a large, historical university dating back to 1869, which also had a branch in Vanderbijlpark, and the University of North-West (formerly the University of Bophuthatswana).[4] With its merged status, the North-West University became one of the largest universities in South Africa with the third largest student population (full-time and distance education) in the country.[5] NWU ranks among top universities locally, in Africa and globally.[6]
target1_text: I-North-West University (NWU) iyunivesithi umphakathi yokucwaninga etholakala emakamu amathathu I-potchefstroom, I-Mahikeng naseVanderbijlpark INingizimu Afrika. Inyuvesi yaba khona ngokuhlangana ngo-2004 kwe-IPotchefstroom University for Christian Higher Education, iyunivesithi enkulu, engokomlando eyaqala ngo-1869, nayo eyayinegatsha eVanderbijlpark, kanye ne-University of North-West (ngaphambili i-University yaseBophuthatswana).[1] Ngokuma kwayo okuhlanganisiwe, i-North-West University yaba ngenye yamanyuvesi amakhulu kakhulu eNingizimu Afrika enenani lesithathu ngobukhulu labafundi (imfundo yesikhathi esigcwele neyesikhathi eside) ezweni.[2] I-NWU iphakathi kwamanyuvesi aphezulu endaweni, e-Afrika nasemhlabeni wonke.[3]
target2_text: I-North-West University (NWU) inyuvesi yomphakathi yokucwaninga etholakala emakamu amathathu I-potchefstroom, I-Mahikeng naseVanderbijlpark INingizimu Afrika. Inyuvesi yaba khona ngokuhlangana ngo-2004 kwe-IPotchefstroom University for Christian Higher Education, iyinyuvesi enkulu, engokomlando eyaqala ngo-1869, nayo eyayinegatsha eVanderbijlpark, kanye ne-University of North-West (eyayibizwa nge-University yaseBophuthatswana).[1] Ngokuma kwayo okuhlanganisiwe, i-North-West University[2] yaba ngenye yamanyuvesi amakhulu kakhulu eNingizimu Afrika enenani lesithathu ngobukhulu labafundi (imfundo yesikhathi esigcwele neyesikhathi eside) ezweni.[3] I-NWU iphakathi kwamanyuvesi aphezulu endaweni, e-Afrika nasemhlabeni wonke.[4][5]

english_source: KwaMhlanga is a town in the Nkangala district municipality of the Mpumalanga province in South Africa. It is the spiritual home of the Ndebele tribe that settled here in the early 18th century. Kwamhlanga now consists of Kwamhlanga, Mandela, Phola, Sun City, Lithuli, Jordan, Mountain View, eMpumelelweni Village, Kingspark Village, and Tweefontein.
target1_text: IKwaMhlanga yidolobha eliseNkangala district municipality yesifundazwe saseMpumalanga INin[1]gizimu Afrika. Iyikhaya elingokomoya lesizwe samaNdebele esahlala lapha ekuqaleni kwekhulu le-18. I-Kwamhlanga manje iqukethe i-KwaMhlanga, i-Mandela, i-Phola, i-Sun City, i-Lithuli, i-Jordan, i-Mountain View, i-eMpumelelweni Village, neKingspark Village.[2]
target2_text: IKwaMhlanga yidolobha eliseMangala district municipality yesifundazwe saseMpumalanga INingizimu Afrika. Iyikhaya elingokomoya lesizwe sAmaNdebele esahlala lapha ekuqaleni kwekhulu le-18. I-Kwamhlanga manje iqukethe i-Kwamlanga, i-Mandela, i-Phola, i-Sun City, i-Lithuli, i-Jordan, i-Mountain View, i-empumelelweni Village, i-Kingspark Village, ne-Tweefontein.

english_source: Raw milk that has not gone sour is sometimes referred to as "sweet milk", because it contains the sugar lactose. Fermentation converts the lactose to lactic acid, which has a sour flavor. Before the invention of refrigeration, raw milk commonly became sour before it could be consumed, and various recipes incorporate such leftover milk as an ingredient. Sour milk produced by fermentation differs in flavor from that produced by acidification, because the acids commonly added in commercial manufacture have different flavors from lactic acid, and also because fermentation can introduce new flavors. Buttermilk is a common modern substitute for naturally soured milk.
target1_text: Ubisi olungaphekiwe olungazange lube olubabayo ngezinye izikhathi lubitwa ngokuthi "ubisi olunoshukela", ngoba luqukethe i-lactose kashukela. Ukubiliswa kuguqula i-lactose ibe yi-lactic acid, enokunambitheka okubabayo. Ngaphambi kokusungulwa kwe-refrigeration, ubisi oluhlaza ngokuvamile lwalubuncuba ngaphambi kokuba lusetshenziswe, futhi izindlela zokupheka ezahlukahlukene zihlanganisa ubisi olusele njengengxenye. Ubisi olubabayo olukhiqizwa ngokuvutshelwa luhlukile kulolo olukhiqizwa nge-acidification, ngoba ama-asidi avame ukufakwa ekukhiqizeni kwezentengiselwano anokunambitheka okuhlukile kusuka ku-asidi ye-lactic, futhi nangenxa yokuthi ukuvutshelwa kungaletha ukunambitheka okusha. Ubisi lwe-buttermilk luyisisetshenziswa kakhulu kunamuhla esikhundleni sobisi olunomso ngokwemvelo.
target2_text: Ubisi olungaphekiwe olungazange lube muncu ngezinye izikhathi lubizwa ngokuthi "ubisi olunoshukela", ngoba luqukethe i-lactose kashukela. Ukuvutshiswa kuguqula i-lactose ibe yi-lactic acid, enokunambitheka okumuncu. Ngaphambi kokusungulwa kwe-refrigeration, ubisi oluhlaza ngokuvamile lwalubamuncu ngaphambi kokuba lusetshenziswe, futhi izindlela zokupheka ezahlukahlukene zihlanganisa ubisi olusele njengengxenye. Ubisi olumuncu olukhiqizwa ngokuvutshelwa luhlukile kulolo olukhiqizwa nge-acidification, ngoba ama-asidi avame ukufakwa ekukhiqizeni kwezentengiselwano anokunambitheka okuhlukile kusuka ku-asidi ye-lactic, futhi nangenxa yokuthi ukuvutshelwa kungaletha ukunambitheka okusha. Ubisi lwe-buttermilk luyisisetshenziswa kakhulu kunamuhla esikhundleni sobisi olunomso ngokwemvelo.

english_source: Minenhle Dlamini (born 7 July 1990), known as Minnie Dlamini, is a South African on-air personality, actress and model.[1] In 2010 she was selected as the new presenter for the SABC 1 Friday live-music show Live Amp.[2]
target1_text: UMinenhle Dlamini (owazalwa ngomhlaka 7 kuNtulikazi 1990), owaziwa ngokuthi UMinnie Dlamini, ungumuntu wezinhlelo zehlelo zomsakazi, umlingikazi nomkhangisi waseNingizimu Afrika.[1] Ngo-2010 wakhethwa njengomsakazi omusha wohlelo lwe-I-SABC 1 Friday live-music Live Amp.[2]
target2_text: UMinenhle Dlamini (owazalwa ngo-7 July 1990), owaziwa ngokuthi UMinnie Dlamini, ungumuntu wezinhlelo zezinhlelo ze-air, umlingisi nomkhangisi waseNingizimu Afrika.[1] Ngo-2010 wakhethwa njengomsakazi omusha wohlelo lwe-I-SABC 1 Friday live-music Live Amp.[2]

english_source: She was born to Jabulani and Queen Dlamini in Durban, KwaZulu-Natal Province of South Africa. She had her early education at Northlands Girls' High School before she proceeded to the University of Cape Town where she studied film, media, drama and economics[incomplete/excluded].[3]
target1_text: Wazalwa nguJabulani neNdlovukazi uDlamini eThekwini, esifundazweni saKwaZulu-Natal eNingizimu Afrika. Wathola imfundo yakhe esemncane e-Northlands Girls' High School ngaphambi kokuba aye e-University of Cape Town lapho afunda khona amabhayisikobho, imithombo yezindaba, imidlalo yaseshashalazini kanye nezomnotho.[3]
target2_text: Wazalwa nguJabulani neNdlovukazi uDlamini IThekwini, esifundazweni saseKwaZulu-Natal INingizimu Afrika. Wathola imfundo yakhe esemncane e-Northlands Girls' High School ngaphambi kokuba aye e-I-University of Cape Town lapho afunda khona amabhayisikobho, imithombo yezindaba, imidlalo yaseshashalazini kanye nezomnotho.[3]

english_source: On 8 July 2017, she married Quinton Jones in a traditional marriage which took place in Glenn Hills, Durban North;[4] before, they went on to do the white wedding on 16 September with exclusive coverage rights sold to Multichoice for R6-million.[5][6]
target1_text: Ngo-8 July 2017, washada noQuinton Jones emshadweni wesiko owaba seGlenn Hills, eThekwini laseNyakatho;[4] ngaphambi kwalokho, baqhubeka benza umshado omhlophe ngo-16 September ngamalungelo okukhethekile okuhlanganisa athengiswe ku-Multichoice nge-R6-million.[5][6]
target2_text: Ngomhlaka 8 kuNtulikazi 2017, washada no-Quinton Jones emshadweni wesiko owaba se-Glenn Hills, eThekwini laseNyakatho;[4] ngaphambi kwalokho, baqhubeka benza umshado omhlophe ngomhlaka 16 kuMandulo ngamalungelo akhethekile okuhlanganisa athengiswe ku-Multichoice nge-R6-million.[5][6]

english_source: On 13 October, through Vuzu Amp on DStv, she debuted the first episode of Minnie Dlamini: Becoming Mrs Jones, a three-part reality docu-series which documents her pre-wedding and post-wedding journey.[7][8] On 19 October, VuzuTV announced via Twitter, that the first episode of Minnie Dlamini: Becoming Mrs Jones became the highest rated show in Vuzu Amp history.[9]
target1_text: Ngo-13 October, nge-Vuzu Amp ku-I-DSTv, waqala isiqephu sokuqala se-Minnie Dlamini: Becoming Mrs Jones, uchungechunge lwe-docu lweqiniso lwezingxenye ezintathu olubonisa uhambo lwakhe lwangaphambi komshado nolwangemva komshado.[7][8] Ngo-19 October, i-VuzuTV yamemezela nge-I-Twitter, ukuthi isiqephu sokuqala se-Minnie Dlamini: Becoming Mrs Jones saba uhlelo olusezingeni eliphakeme kakhulu emlandweni we-Vuzo Amp.[9]
target2_text: Ngomhlaka 13 kuMfumfu, nge-Vuzu Amp ku-I-DSTv, waqala isiqephu sokuqala se-Minnie Dlamini: Becoming Mrs Jones, uchungechunge lwe-docu lweqiniso lwezingxenye ezintathu olubonisa uhambo lwakhe lwangaphambi komshado nolwangemva komshado.[7][8] Ngomhlaka 19 kuMfumfu, i-VuzuTV yamemezela nge-Twitter, ukuthi isiqephu sokuqala se-Minnie Dlamini: Becoming Mrs Jones saba uhlelo olusezingeni eliphakeme kakhulu emlandweni we-Vuzo Amp.[9]

english_source: While studying at the University of Cape Town, Dlamini was a presenter for LIVE on 16 June 2010, after she made her debut screen appearance while covering the "Youth Day" and "World Cup celebrations" shows.[14][15] She later co-hosted Mzansi Insider, an SABC 1's lifestyle show. In 2012, she resigned from the show in order to pursue a career in acting.[16] In 2013, Minnie switched to sports broadcasting by co-hosting Soccerzone with Thomas Mlambo, until in 2016 when the show's format was changed by SABC 1.[17] She has since co-hosted several local and international award ceremonies, including the 14th Metro FM Music Awards, 2016 Africa Magic Viewers Choice Awards, the PSL Awards and the South African Film and Television Awards.[18][19][20]
target1_text: Ngesikhathi efunda e-University of Cape Town, uDlamini wayengumxhumanisi we- LIVE ngomhlaka 16 kuNhlangulana 2010, ngemuva kokubonakala kwakhe kokuqala kuyi-screen ngenkathi ehlanganisa imibukiso ye- "Youth Day" ne- "World Cup celebrations".[14][15] Kamuva wabamba i-Mzansi Insider, uhlelo lwe-I-SABC 1. Ngo-2012, wasula kulolu hlelo ukuze aphishekele umsebenzi wokudlala.[16] Ngo-2013, uMinnie washintsha waba owokusakaza kwezemidlalo ngokubambisana ne-Soccerzone noThomas Mlambo, kwaze kwaba ngu-2016 lapho uhlelo lwe-show lushintshwa yi-SABC 1.[17] Kusukela lapho ubambe imikhosi eminingana yendawo neyamazwe omhlaba, kufaka phakathi i-14th Metro FM Music Awards, i-2016 I-Africa Magic Viewers Choice Awards, i-PSL Awards kanye ne-South African Film and Television Awards.[18][19][20]

english_source: The results of racing events are decided by finishing position (or time, where measured), while the jumps and throws are won by the athlete that achieves the highest or furthest measurement from a series of attempts. The simplicity of the competitions, and the lack of a need for expensive equipment, makes athletics one of the most common types of sports in the world. Athletics is mostly an individual sport, with the exception of relay races and competitions which combine athletes' performances for a team score, such as cross country.
target1_text: Imiphumela yemicimbi umjaho inqunywa ngokuma kokuqeda (noma isikhathi, lapho kulinganiswa khona), kuyilapho ukugxuma nokuphonsa kunqotshwa ngumdlali ofinyelela isilinganiso esiphakeme noma esiqhele kakhulu ochungechungeni lwemizamo. Ukulula kwemincintiswano, kanye nokuntuleka kwesidingo semishini ebizayo, kwenza i-athletics ibe ngenye yezinhlobo ezivame kakhulu zemidlalo emhlabeni. I-Athletics ngokuyinhloko iwumdlalo womuntu ngamunye, ngaphandle kwemincintiswano ye-relay kanye nemincintiswano ehlanganisa ukusebenza kwabasubathi ukuze kube neqembu, njenge-cross country.

Ukulula kwemincintiswano, kanye nokuntuleka kwesidingo semishini ebizayo, kwenza i-athletics ibe ngenye yezinhlobo ezivame kakhulu zemidlalo emhlabeni. I-Athletics ngokuyinhloko iwumdlalo womuntu ngamunye, ngaphandle kwemincintiswano ye-relay kanye nemincintiswano ehlanganisa ukusebenza kwabasubathi ukuze kube neqembu, njenge-cross country.

english_source: Potchefstroom High School for Boys is a public English medium high school for boys situated in Potchefstroom in the North West province of South Africa. It is one of the oldest schools in South Africa.[1]
target1_text: IPotchefstroom High School for Boys iyisikole esiphakeme somphakathi esiphakathi saseNgilandi sabafana esisePotchefstroom esifundazweni saseNyakatho Ntshonalanga iNingizimu Afrika. Ingenye yezikole ezindala kakhulu eNingizimu Afrika.[1]
target2_text: I-potchefstroom High School for Boys iyisikole esiphakeme somphakathi esiphakathi saseNgilandi sabafana esisePotchefstrum esifundazweni sasENyakatho Ntshonalanga INingizimu Afrika. Ingenye yezikole ezindala kakhulu eNingizimu Afrika.[1]

english_source: Apart from the local schools Potchefstroom Boys' traditional sporting rivals include Pretoria Boys’ High, King Edwards, Jeppe Boys, Parktown Boys and St Stithians each year.[citation needed]

english_source: Khumalo was discovered while performing at a gospel talent search and signed a record deal with Bonsai Entertainment, released her début studio album, T.K.O (2005).[2] She shot to fame after the release of her début album, T.K.O (2005).[3] She was named the Best Newcomer of 2005 in the Afro Pop music circuit. The Past, the Present, the Future album was released in November 2012. In May 2013, She scooped an award at the 19th South African Music Awards.[4][5]
target1_text: UKhumalo watholakala ngenkathi edlala ekufuneni ithalenta le-gospel futhi wasayina isivumelwano sokubhalisa ne-Bonsai Entertainment, wakhipha i-albhamu yakhe yokuqala, i-T.K.O (2005).[2] Udume kakhulu ngemuva kokukhululwa kwe-albhamu yakhe yokuqala, i-T.K.O (2005).[3] Wabizwa ngokuthi uMusha Omuhle Kakhulu ka-2005 esifundeni somculo we-Afro Pop. I-albhamu ethi Past, the Present, the Future yakhululwa ngoNovemba 2012. NgoMeyi 2013, wathola umklomelo kuma-19th South African Music Awards.[4][5]
target2_text: UKhumalo watholakala ngenkathi edlala ekufuneni ithalenta le-gospel futhi wasayina isivumelwano sokubhalisa ne-Bonsai Entertainment, wakhipha i-albhamu yakhe yokuqala, i-T.K.O (2005).[2] Udume kakhulu ngemuva kokukhululwa kwe-albhamu yakhe yokuqala, i-T.K.O (2005).[3] Wabizwa ngokuthi uMusha Omuhle Kakhulu ka-2005 esifundeni somculo we-Afro Pop. I-albhamu ethi Past, the Present, the Future yakhululwa ngoLwezi wezi-2012. NgoNhlaba wezi-2013, wathola umklomelo kuma-19th South African Music Awards.[4][5]

english_source: Batsogile Lovederia "Rebecca" Malope (born June 30, 1968[1]) is a South African gospel singer. She is known as "The Queen of Gospel."[2] Her music career spans more than three decades. She has sold at least 10 million albums worldwide, making her one of the best-selling gospel artists of all time. Most of the 36 albums she has released have reached multi-platinum status.
target1_text: I-Batsogile Lovederia "uRebecca" Malope (owazalwa ngoJuni 30, 1968[1]) ungumculi we-gospel waseNingizimu Afrika. Waziwa ngokuthi "iNdlovukazi yeVangeli".[2] Umsebenzi wakhe womculo uhlanganisa iminyaka engaphezu kwamashumi amathathu. Udayise okungenani ama-alibhamu ayizigidi eziyishumi emhlabeni wonke, okwenza ukuthi abe ngomunye wabaculi be-gospel abathengiswa kakhulu kunabo bonke. Iningi lama-alibhamu angama-36 akhiphe afinyelele esimweni se-multi-platinum.

Iningi lama-albhamu angu-36 akhiphe afinyelele esimweni se-multi-platinum.

english_source: Anthony Armand Ferguson Padilla[7] (born February 12, 1984) is an American professional mixed martial artist. He currently competes in the Welterweight division in the Ultimate Fighting Championship (UFC). He is a former Interim UFC Lightweight Champion.[8][9] Ferguson debuted in 2008, and has been with the UFC since he won The Ultimate Fighter 13 in 2011. He is trained in freestyle wrestling, boxing, jiu-jitsu,[4] Muay Thai,[10] and Wing Chun.[11]
target1_text: U-Anthony Armand Ferguson Padilla[1] (wazalwa ku Nhlolanja mhla zingama-12 kunyaka wesi1984) ungumculi waseMelika we-mixed martial arts. Njengamanje uncintisana esigabeni se-Welterweight ku-Ultimate Fighting Championship (UFC). Wayengumdlali we-Interim UFC Lightweight Champion.[2][3] U-Ferguson waqala ngo-2008, futhi ubelokhu ese-UFC selokhu anqoba i-The I-Ultimate Fighter 13 ngo-2011. Uqeqeshelwe I-freestyle wrestling, isibhakela, i-ju-jitsu, I-Muay Thai, kanye ne-I-Wing Chun.[4][5]
target2_text: U-Anthony Armand Ferguson Padilla[1] (owazalwa ngoFebhuwari 12, 1984) ungumculi waseMelika we-mixed martial arts. Njengamanje uncintisana esigabeni se-Welterweight ku-Ultimate Fighting Championship (UFC). Wayengumdlali we-Interim UFC Lightweight Champion.[2][3] U-Ferguson waqala ngo-2008, futhi ubelokhu ese-UFC selokhu anqoba i-The I-Ultimate Fighter 13 ngo-2011. Uqeqeshelwe I-freestyle wrestling, isibhakela, i-ju-jitsu, I-Muay Thai, kanye ne-I-Wing Chun.[4][5]

english_source: Conor John Gallagher (born 6 February 2000) is an English professional footballer who plays as a midfielder for La Liga club Atlético Madrid and the England national team.
target1_text: UConor UJohn Gallagher (owazalwa ziyi-6 kuNhlolanja ngonyaka wezi 2000) ungumdlali webhola likanobhutshuzwayo waseNgilandi odlala njengomdlali ophakathi weqembu le-La Liga i-I-Atletico Madrid Iqembu lesizwe laseNgilandi.

english_source: Siyabonga Eugene Nomvethe (/nɒmˈvɛteɪ/; born 2 December 1977) is a South African former professional soccer player who played as a forward.
target1_text: Siyabonga Eugene Nomvethe (/nɒmˈvɛteɪ/; wazalwa ngo-2 Disemba 1977) ungumdlali ibhola likanobhutshuzwayo waseNingizimu Afrika owayengumdlali oqeqeshiwe owayedlala njengomdlali ohola phambili.
target2_text: Siyabonga Eugene Nomvethe wazalwa ngo-2 kuZibandlela 1977) ungumdlali webhola likanobhutshuzwayo waseNingizimu Afrika owayengumdlali oqeqeshiwe owayedlala njengomdlali ohola phambili.

english_source: Nomvethe played in several European leagues.[3] Nomvethe represented the South Africa national team from his debut on 6 May 1999, and he played in the 2002 and 2010 World Cups. He is the highest all-time goal scorer in the PSL.[4]
target1_text: UNomvethe wadlala kuma-league amaningana aseYurophu.[1] UNomvethe wamelela Iqembu lesizwe laseNingizimu Afrika kusukela ekuqaleni kwakhe ngo-6 Meyi 1999, futhi wadlala kumaNdebe Yomhlaba ka-2002 no-2010. Ungumdlali we-PSL onamagoli aphakeme kunabo bonke.[2]
target2_text: UNomvethe wadlala kuma-league amaningana aseYurophu.[1] UNomvethe wamela Iqembu lesizwe laseNingizimu Afrika kusukela ekuqaleni kwakhe ngo-6 kuNhlaba 1999, futhi wadlala kumaNdebe Yomhlaba ka-2002 no-2010. Ungumdlali we-PSL onamagoli aphakeme kunabo bonke.[2]

english_source: David Tlale (29 January 1975) is a South African fashion designer. He was born in Vosloorus in South Africa. He was raised by his single mother. His work has been showcased at the Cape Town Fashion Week, New York Fashion Week, and Paris Fashion Week. He has also designed collections for major retailers like Edgars. Tlale was a semi-finalist at the South African Fashion Week Elle New Talent Show Competition in 2002. In May 2003, Tlale started design studios in Cape Town and Johannesburg.[1][2][3]
target1_text: UDavid Tlale (29 kuMasingane 1975) ungumklami wemfashini waseNingizimu Afrika. Wazalelwa e-I-Vosloorus eNingizimu Afrika.[1] Wakhuliswa unina ongayedwa. Umsebenzi wakhe uboniswe eKapa Fashion Week, eNew York Fashion Week, naseParis Fashion Week. Uphinde waklama amaqoqo abathengisi abakhulu njenge-Edgars. UTlale wafika engxenyeni yokugcina emncintiswaneni we-Elle New Talent Show waseNingizimu Afrika ngo-2002. NgoMeyi 2003, iTlale yaqala ama-studio wokuklama IKapa naseGoli.[2][3][4]
target2_text: UDavid Tlale (29 January 1975) ungumklami wemfashini waseNingizimu Afrika. Wazalelwa e-I-Vosloorus eNingizimu Afrika. Wakhuliswa unina ongayedwa. Umsebenzi wakhe uboniswe eKapa Fashion Week, eNew York Fashion Week, naseParis Fashion Week. Uphinde waklama amaqoqo abathengisi abakhulu njenge-Edgars. english_source: Relebohile Mofokeng (né Ratomo; born 23 October 2004) is a South African professional footballer who plays as a midfielder and winger for Orlando Pirates and the South Africa national team.[3][4]
target1_text: URelebohile I-Mofokeng (ozalwa ngoRatomo; uzalwa mhla zingama-23 kuMfumfu ngonyaka we-2004) ungumdlali webhola likanobhutshuzwayo waseNingizimu Afrika odlala njengomdlali ophakathi nendawo kanye ne-winger ye-Orlando Pirates neqembu lesizwe laseNingizimu Afrika.[1][2]
target2_text: URelebohile I-Mofokeng (ozalwa ngoRatomo; wazalwa ngo-23 October 2004) ungumdlali webhola likanobhutshuzwayo waseNingizimu Afrika odlala njengomdlali ophakathi nendawo kanye ne-winger ye-Orlando Pirates Iqembu lesizwe laseNingizimu Afrika.[1][2]

english_source: Having joined the University of Pretoria from Dynamos at the start of the 2012–13 season, Zungu helped AmaTuks to a top eight finish in the club's debut campaign in the PSL. At the end of the season it was announced that Zungu would be joining Mamelodi Sundowns in a swap deal, with Buhle Mkhwanazi and Siyabonga Ngubane joining University of Pretoria.[1]
target1_text: Ngemva kokujoyina I-University of Pretoria ivela ku-Dynamos ekuqaleni kwenkathi ye-2012-13, uZungu wasiza i-AmaTuks ukuba ifinyelele ezingeni eliphakeme lesishiyagalombili emkhankasweni wokuqala weqembu ku-PSL. Ekupheleni kwenkathi kwamenyezelwa ukuthi uZungu uzojoyina iMamelodi Sundowns ngesivumelwano sokushintshana, UBuhle Mkhwanazi noSyabonga Ngubane bazojoyina i-University of Pretoria.[1]
target2_text: Ngemva kokujoyina I-University of Pretoria evela ku-Dynamos ekuqaleni konyaka ka 2012 kuya 2013, uZungu wasiza i-AmaTuks ukuba ifinyelele ezingeni eliphakeme lesishiyagalombili emkhankasweni wokuqala weqembu ku-PSL. Ekupheleni kwenkathi kwamenyezelwa ukuthi uZungu uzojoyina iMamelodi Sundowns ngesivumelwano sokushintshana, UBuhle Mkhwanazi noSyabonga Ngubane bazojoyina i-University of Pretoria.[1]

english_source: Her career began in 1996 after she graduated with a Diploma in Accounting from Durban University of Technology. She went on to work in finance departments for numerous companies, but then went into business for herself. She started off with small projects from the local municipality which included feeding schemes, painting and construction work.[1]
target1_text: Umsebenzi wakhe waqala ngo-1996 ngemuva kokuphothula nge-Diploma in Accounting e-Durban University of Technology. Waqhubeka esebenza eminyangweni yezezimali ezinkampanini eziningi, kodwa wabe eseqala ibhizinisi lakhe. Waqala ngemisebenzi emincane evela kumasipala wendawo eyayihlanganisa amacebo okondla, ukudweba kanye nomsebenzi wokwakha.[1]
target2_text: Umsebenzi wakhe waqala ngo 1996 ngemuva kokuphothula kwi Diploma in Accounting e Durban University of Technology. Waqhubeka wayosebenza eminyangweni yezezimali ezinkampanini eziningi kodwa wabe eseqala ibhizinisi lakhe. Waqala ngemisebenzi emincane evela kumasipala wendawo eyayihlanganisa amacebo okondla, ukudweba kanye nomsebenzi wokwakha[1].[2]

english_source: Forbes Africa ranked Motha number 18 on Forbes Africa 30 under 30. His accolades include ten South African Music Awards, four Metro FM Music Awards, three AmaPiano Music Awards, two Mzansi Viewers Choice Awards, one Sunday Times GenNext, and one Dance Music Awards South Africa.
target1_text: I-Forbes Africa ibeke i-Motha endaweni engu-18 ku-Forbes Afrika engu-30 ngaphansi kuka-30. Ukuhlonishwa kwakhe kufaka phakathi ama-South African Music Awards ayishumi, ama-Metro FM Music Awards amane, ama-AmaPiano Music Awards amathathu, ama- Mzansi Viewers Choice Awards amabili, i-Sunday Times GenNext eyodwa, kanye ne-Dance Music Awards eyodwa eNingizimu Afrika.
target2_text: I-Forbes Africa ibeke i-Motha endaweni engunombolo eyi-18 ku-Forbes Afrika engu-30 ngaphansi kuka-30. Ukuhlonishwa kwakhe kufaka phakathi ama-South African Music Awards ayishumi, ama-Metro FM Music Awards amane, ama-AmaPiano Music Awards amathathu, ama- Mzansi Viewers Choice Awards amabili, i-Sunday Times GenNext eyodwa, kanye ne-Dance Music Awards eyodwa eNingizimu Afrika.

english_source: Makazole Drex Mapimpi (born 26 July 1990) is a South African professional rugby union player for the Sharks in the United Rugby Championship and South Africa national team. He usually plays as a winger and centre.[1] He was part of the winning Springboks of the 2019 Rugby World Cup in Japan and the 2023 Rugby World Cup in France. He became the first South African to score a try in a World Cup Final.
target1_text: UMakazole Drex Mapimpi (owazalwa ngo-26 Ntulikazi 1990) ungumdlali webhola lombhoxo waseNingizimu Afrika we-Sharks e-United Rugby Championship naseqenjini lesizwe laseNingizimu Afrika. Ngokuvamile udlala njenge-winger ne-centre.[1] Wayeyingxenye ye-Springboks ewinayo ye-2019 Rugby World Cup eJapane kanye ne-2023 Rugby World cup eFrance. Waba ngumuntu wokuqala waseNingizimu Afrika owazama ukufaka igoli emdlalweni wokugcina weNdebe Yomhlaba.
target2_text: UMakazole Drex Mapimpi (owazalwa ngo-26 Julayi 1990) ungumdlali we-rugby union waseNingizimu Afrika we-Sharks e-United Rugby Championship naseqenjini lesizwe laseNingizimu Afrika. Ngokuvamile udlala njenge-winger ne-centre.[1] Wayeyingxenye ye-Springboks ewinayo ye-2019 Rugby World Cup eJapane kanye ne-2023 Rugby World cup eFrance. Waba ngumuntu wokuqala waseNingizimu Afrika owazama ukufaka igoli emdlalweni wokugcina weNdebe Yomhlaba.

english_source: Gayton McKenzie (born 10 March 1974) is a South African politician who is currently serving as Minister of Sports, Arts and Culture since July 2024.
target1_text: UGayton McKenzie (owazalwa ngezi10 kundasa1974) ungusopolitiki waseNingizimu Afrika njengamanje osebenza njengoNgqongqoshe Wezemidlalo, Ubuciko Namasiko kusukela ngoJulayi 2024.
target2_text: UGayton McKenzie (owazalwa ngo-10 March 1974) ungusopolitiki waseNingizimu Afrika njengamanje osebenza njengoNgqongqoshe Wezemidlalo, Ubuciko Namasiko kusukela ngoJulayi 2024.

english_source: After spending eight years in jail from age 21 for armed robbery, McKenzie became a businessman, motivational speaker, author and former Executive Mayor of the Central Karoo District Municipality.[2][3][4] He is also the president of the Patriotic Alliance political party.[5] He came to prominence in the early 2000s for his role in a prison exposé that eventually led to his early release amid an investigation of prison corruption by the Jali Commission of Inquiry.[6] McKenzie grew up in the Heidedal neighborhood of Bloemfontein, South Africa.[7]
target1_text: Ngemva kokuchitha iminyaka eyisishiyagalombili ejele kusukela eneminyaka engama shumi amabili nanye ngenxa yokuphanga okuhlomile, uMcKenzie waba usomabhizinisi, isikhulumi esishukumisayo, umbhali futhi owayengumphathi-dolobha we-Central Karoo District Municipality.[1][2][3] Uphinde abe ngumongameli weqembu lezombusazwe le-Patriot Alliance.[4] Wavela ekuqashweni kwawo-2000 ngendima yakhe ekudalweni kwejele okwagcina kuholele ekukhululweni kwakhe kusenesikhathi phakathi kocwaningo lwenkohlakalo yasejele lweJali Commission of Inquiry.[5] UMcKenzie wakhulela endaweni yaseHeidedal I-Bloemfontein, eNingizimu Afrika.[6]
target2_text: Ngemva kokuchitha iminyaka eyisishiyagalombili ejele kusukela eneminyaka engu-21 ngenxa yokuphanga okuhlomile, uMcKenzie waba usomabhizinisi, isikhulumi esishukumisayo, umbhali futhi owayengumphathi-dolobha we-Central Karoo District Municipality.[1][2][3] Uphinde abe ngumongameli weqembu lezombusazwe le-Patriot Alliance.[4] Wavela ekuqashweni kwawo-2000 ngendima yakhe ekudalweni kwejele okwagcina kuholele ekukhululweni kwakhe kusenesikhathi phakathi kocwaningo lwenkohlakalo yasejele lweJali Commission of Inquiry.[5] UMcKenzie wakhulela endaweni yaseHeidedal I-Bloemfontein, eNingizimu Afrika.[6]

english_source: Ntombezinhle Jiyane (born 30 December 1983), known professionally as DJ Zinhle, is a South African DJ, producer, media personality and businesswoman.
target1_text: UNtombezinhle Jiyane (owazalwa ngo-30 Disemba 1983), owaziwa ngokuthi UDJ Zinhle, ungumdlali we-DJ waseNingizimu Afrika, umkhiqizi, umuntu wezindaba futhi usomabhizinisi wesifazane.
target2_text: UNtombezinhle Jiyane (owazalwa ngomhlaka 30 kuZibandlela 1983), owaziwa ngokuthi UDJ Zinhle, ungumdlali we-DJ waseNingizimu Afrika, umkhiqizi, umuntu wezindaba futhi usomabhizinisi wesifazane.

english_source: "Thula" by Zinhle and Cici was released on July 7, 2023. The song debuted number 3 in South Africa and charted number 1 on Metro FM Top 30 Countdown charts.[17][18]
target1_text: "I-Thula" kaZinhle noCici yakhululwa ngomhlaka 7 kuNtulikazi, 2023. Le ngoma yaqala ukuba ngu-3 eNingizimu Afrika futhi yaba ngu-1 kumachashi e-Metro FM Top 30 Countdown.[15][16]
target2_text: "I-Thula" kaZinhle noCci yakhululwa ngoJulayi 7, 2023. Le ngoma yaqala ukuba ngu-3 eNingizimu Afrika futhi yaba ngu-1 kumachashi e-Metro FM Top 30 Countdown.[15][16]

english_source: Thulisile Phongolo was born on 22 January 1994.[2] Her boyfriend, DJ Maphorisa, was arrested on 7 May 2023 after punching Phongolo in her Sandton, Johannesburg apartment; he was charged with multiple counts of assault.[3]
target1_text: UThulisile Phongolo wazalwa ngo-22 January 1994. Isoka lakhe, I-DJ Maphorisa, laboshwa ngo-7 Meyi 2023 ngemuva ukushaya uPhongolo efulethini lakhe laseSandton, IGoli; wamangalelwa ngamacala amaningi ukuhlaselwa.
target2_text: UThulisile Phongolo wazalwa ngo-22 January 1994. Isoka lakhe, nguDJ Maphorisa, laboshwa ngeziyi-7 kuMeyi 2023 ngemuva kokukushaya uPhongolo efulethini lakhe laseSandton eGoli, wamangalelwa ngamacala amaningi ukuhlaselwa.

english_source: Jessica Nkosi (born 20 January 1990) is a South African actress and TV presenter, best known for her leading roles in M-Net commissioned telenovelas Isibaya, Ayeye,[2] The Queen, and Lavish.[3]
target1_text: UJessica Nkosi (owazalwa ngo-20 January 1990) ungumlingisi waseNingizimu Afrika futhi ungumsakazi we-TV, owaziwa kakhulu ngezingxenye zakhe eziholayo kuma-telenovelas aqashwe yI-M-Net Isibaya, Ayeye, [1] The Queen, and Lavish. [2]
target2_text: UJessica Nkosi wazalwa mhla singama -20 ku Masingana 1990) ungumlingisi waseNingizimu Afrika[1] futhi ungumsakazi kamabonakude,owaziwa kakhulu ngezingxenye zakhe eziholayo kuma-telenovelas aqashwe yI-M-Net Isibaya, Ayeye, [2] The Queen, and Lavish. [3]

english_source: Jessica Nkosi was born in Empangeni, KwaZulu-Natal to Jabu Nkosi and Nhlanhlayethu Ntuli. Nkosi moved to Eshowe, KwaZulu-Natal after the separation of her parents. While Nkosi was in Grade 11, her father died from Hodgkin's Lymphoma.[4]
target1_text: UJessica Nkosi wazalelwa endaweni yasempangeni, KwaZulu-Natal ezalwa ngủ Jabu Nkosi noNhlanhlayethu Ntuli. UNkoshi wathuthela e-I-Eshowe, eKwaZulu-Natal ngemuva kokuhlukana kwabazali bakhe. Ngenkathi uN Nkosi eseBangeni le-11, uyise washona ngenxa ye-Hodgkin's Lymphoma.[4]
target2_text: UJessica Nkosi wazalelwa e-I-Empangeni, KwaZulu-Natal kuJabu Nkosi noNhlanhlayethu Ntuli. UNkoshi wathuthela e-I-Eshowe, eKwaZulu-Natal ngemuva kokuhlukana kwabazali bakhe. Ngenkathi uN Nkosi eseBangeni le-11, uyise washona ngenxa ye-Hodgkin's Lymphoma.[3]

english_source: Xenophobia (from Ancient Greek: ξένος (xénos), "strange, foreign, or alien", and φόβος (phóbos), "fear")[1] is the fear or dislike of anything which is perceived as being foreign or strange.[2][3][4] It is an expression which is based on the perception that a conflict exists between an in-group and an out-group and it may manifest itself in suspicion of one group's activities by members of the other group, a desire to eliminate the presence of the group which is the target of suspicion, and fear of losing a national, ethnic, or racial identity.[5][6]
target1_text: I-Xenophobia (kususelwa esiGrekini sasendulo)[1], "okuyinqaba, okuvela kwamanye amazwe, noma okuvela kwamanye amazwe", kanye ne- φόβος (phóbos), "ukwesaba") [2] iwukwesaba noma ukungawuthandi noma yini eqondwa njengento engaziwa.[3][4][5] Kuyinkulumo esekelwe embonweni wokuthi kukhona ukungqubuzana phakathi kweqembu elingaphakathi neqembu elingaphandle futhi kungabonakala ngokusolwa kwemisebenzi yeqembu elilodwa ngamalunga elinye iqembu, isifiso sokuqeda ukuba khona kweqembu eliyi-target yokusolwa, kanye nokwesaba ukulahlekelwa ubuzwe, ubuhlanga, noma uhlanga.[6][7]
target2_text: I-Xenophobia (kususelwa esiGrekini sasendulo), "okuyinqaba, okuvela kwamanye amazwe, noma okuvela kwamanye amazwe", kanye ne- φόβος (phóbos), "ukwesaba") [1] iwukwesaba noma ukungawuthandi noma yini eqondwa njengento engaziwa.[2][3][4] Kuyinkulumo esekelwe embonweni wokuthi kukhona ukungqubuzana phakathi kweqembu elingaphakathi neqembu elingaphandle futhi kungabonakala ngokusolwa kwemisebenzi yeqembu elilodwa ngamalungu elinye iqembu, isifiso sokuqeda ukuba khona kweqembu eliyi-target yokusolwa, kanye nokwesaba ukulahlekelwa ubuzwe, ubuhlanga, noma ubuhlanga.[5][6]

english_source: Desmond Tutu (7 October 1931 – 26 December 2021) was a South African Anglican bishop and theologian, known for his work as an anti-apartheid and human rights activist. He was Bishop of Johannesburg from 1985 to 1986 and then Archbishop of Cape Town from 1986 to 1996, in both cases being the first Black African to hold the position. Theologically, he sought to fuse ideas from Black theology with African theology.
target1_text: UDesmond Tutu (7 October 1931 - 26 December 2021) wayengUmbhishobhi waseSheshi waseNingizimu Afrika futhi eyisazi semfundiso yenkolo, owaziwa ngomsebenzi wakhe njengomlweli wamalungelo abantu omelene nobandlululo.   WayengUmbhishobhi waseGoli kusukela ngo-1985 kuya ku-1986 wabe eseba Umbhishobhi Omkhulu waseKapa kusukela ngo-1986 kuya ku-1996, kuzo zombili izimo engum-Afrika wokuqala ukuba athathe isikhundla. Ngokwenkolo, wafuna ukuhlanganisa imibono Imfundiso yenkolo yabamnyama nemfundiso yenkolo yase-Afrika.
target2_text: UDesmond Tutu (7 October 1931 - 26 December 2021) wayengu mbhishobhi waseSheshi waseNingizimu Afrika futhi eyisazi semfundiso yenkolo, owaziwa ngomsebenzi wakhe njengomlweli wamalungelo abantu omelene nobandlululo.   Wayengu mbhishobhi waseGoli kusukela ngonyaka ka-1985 kuya ku-1986 wabe eseba Umbhishobhi Omkhulu waseKapa kusukela ngonyaka ka -1986 kuya ku-1996, kuzo zombili izimo engumu-Afrika wokuqala ukuba athathe isikhundla. Ngokwenkolo, wafuna ukuhlanganisa imibono Imfundiso yenkolo yabamnyama nemfundiso yenkolo yase-Afrika.[1]

english_source: A biopic which chronicles the life of Mandoza, titled Nkalakatha: The Life of Mandoza premiered on BET on the 16th of August 2023, in which Wiseman Mncube portrayed him.[2]
target1_text: [2]I-biopic elandisa ngokuphila kukaMandoza, enesihloko esithi Nkalakatha: Impilo kaMandoza yaqala ukubonwa ku-BET ngomhla ziyi-16 kuNcwaba 2023, lapho uWiseman Mncube amfanekisa khona.[3]
target2_text: I-biopic elandisa ngokuphila kukaMandoza, enesihloko esithi Nkalakatha: The Life of Mandoza yaqala ukubonwa ku-BET ngomhla ka-16 August 2023, lapho uWiseman Mncube amfanekisa khona.[2]

english_source: Sipho Chaine (born 14 December 1996) is a South African soccer player who plays as a goalkeeper for Orlando Pirates in the South African Premier Division.
target1_text: I-Sipho Chain (owazalwa nge-14 kuZibandlela wezi-1996) ungumdlali ibhola likanobhutshuzwayo waseNingizimu Afrika odlala njengomgcini webhola we-Orlando Pirates e-Premier Division yaseNingizimu Afrika.
target2_text: I-Sipho Chain (owazalwa ngo-14 Disemba 1996) ungumdlali ibhola likanobhutshuzwayo waseNingizimu Afrika odlala njengomgcini webhola we-Orlando Pirates e-Premier Division yaseNingizimu Afrika.

english_source: Pitso John Hamilton Mosimane (born 26 July 1964) is a South African former professional football player and is the current manager of Abha. He is the former coach of SuperSport United, Mamelodi Sundowns, Al Ahly, Al Ahli Saudi and Al Wahda.
target1_text: UPitso John Hamilton Mosimane (owazalwa ngo-26 Ntulikazi 1964) ungumdlali webhola likanobhutshuzwayo waseNingizimu Afrika futhi ungumphathi wamanje we-U-Abha. Wayengumqeqeshi we-I-SuperSport United, Mamelodi Sundowns, U-Al Ahly, I-Al Ahli Saudi kanye ne-I-Al Wahda.
target2_text: UPitso John Hamilton Mosimane (owazalwa ngo-26 July 1964) ungumdlali ibhola likanobhutshuzwayo waseNingizimu Afrika futhi ungumphathi wamanje we-U-Abha. Wayengumqeqeshi we-I-SuperSport United, Mamelodi Sundowns, U-Al Ahly, I-Al Ahli Saudi kanye ne-I-Al Wahda.

english_source: Born in Kagiso,[2] Mosimane is one of the longest serving and most decorated coaches in all of South African football, having won multiple major trophies with SuperSport United between 2001 and 2007 and Mamelodi Sundowns between 2012 and 2020.
target1_text: Wazalelwa eKagiso, [1] uMosimane ungomunye wabaqeqeshi abasebenza isikhathi eside futhi abahlonishwa kakhulu kulo lonke ibhola likanobhutshuzwayo laseNingizimu Afrika, njengoba anqobe izindondo eziningi ezinkulu nge-I-SuperSport United phakathi kuka-2001 no-2007 kanye ne-Mamelodi Sundowns phakathi kuka-2012 no-2020.
target2_text: Wazalelwa eKagiso, [1] uPitso Mosimane ungomunye wabaqeqeshi abasebenza isikhathi eside futhi abahlonishwa kakhulu kulo lonke ibhola likanobhutshuzwayo laseNingizimu Afrika, njengoba anqobe izindondo eziningi ezinkulu nge-I-SuperSport United phakathi kuka-2001 no-2007 kanye ne-Mamelodi Sundowns phakathi kuka-2012 no-2020.[1]

english_source: Traditional areas of linguistic analysis correspond to syntax (rules governing the structure of sentences), semantics (meaning), morphology (structure of words), phonetics (speech sounds and equivalent gestures in sign languages), phonology (the abstract sound system of a particular language), and pragmatics (how social context contributes to meaning).[6] Subdisciplines such as biolinguistics (the study of the biological variables and evolution of language) and psycholinguistics (the study of psychological factors in human language) bridge many of these divisions.[7]
target1_text: Izindawo ezingokwesiko zokuhlaziywa kolimi zihambisana ne-syntax (imithetho ebusa ukwakheka kwemisho), i-semantics (okusho), i-morphology (ukwakheka kwamagama), i-phonetics (imisindo yokukhuluma kanye nokushukuma komzimba okufana Izilimi zezandla), i-fonology (isimiso sokusebenza esifihlekile solimi oluthile), kanye ne-pragmatics (indlela umongo wezenhlalo onikela ngayo enchazelweni).[3] Izifundo ezincane ezifana ne-biolinguistics (ukuhlolwa kwezinguquko zezinto eziphilayo nokuziphendukela kolimi) kanye ne-psycholinguistics ("ukuhlolwa kwezici ezingokwengqondo olimini lwesintu) kuhlanganisa eziningi zalezi zindawo.[4]
target2_text: Izindawo ezingokwesiko zokuhlaziywa kolimi zihambisana ne-syntax (imithetho ebusa ukwakheka kwemisho), i-semantiki (okusho), i-mofoloji (ukwakheka kwamagama), ifonetiki (imisindo yokukhuluma kanye nokushukuma komzimba okufana Izilimi zezandla), i-fonoloji (isimiso sokusebenza esifihlekile solimi oluthile), kanye ne-pragmatiki (indlela umongo wezenhlalo onikela ngayo enchazelweni).[3] Izifundo ezincane ezifana ne-biolinguistics (ukuhlolwa kwezinguquko zezinto eziphilayo nokuziphendukela kolimi) kanye ne-psycholinguistics ("ukuhlolwa kwezici ezingokwengqondo olimini lwesintu) kuhlanganisa eziningi zalezi zindawo.[4]

english_source: Pongola (also known in Zulu as oPhongolo) is a town on the north bank of the uPhongolo River, in a fertile valley on the N2, near the Lubombo Mountains, in the valleys of Zululand, easily accessible to the Swaziland border posts. It was part of the Transvaal panhandle between the Phongolo (Natal) and Swaziland (now Eswatini) until 1994, when it was transferred to KwaZulu-Natal.
target1_text: IPongo (eyaziwa nangesiZulu ngokuthi i-oPhongolo) iyidolobha elisogwini olusenyakatho UMfula iPhongolo, esigodini esivundile ku-N2, eduze kwezintaba zaseLubombo, ezigodini zaseZululand, elifinyeleleka kalula ezikhungweni zomngcele waseSwaziland. Kwakuyingxenye ye-panhandle yaseTransvaal phakathi kwePhongolo (I-Natal) ISwaziland (manje eyi-Eswatini) kwaze kwaba ngo-1994, lapho idluliselwa eKwaZulu-Natal.
target2_text: uPongola (eyaziwa nangesiZulu ngokuthi i-oPhongolo) iyidolobhaelisogwini olusenyakatho UMfula iPhongolo, isesigodini esivundile ku-N2, eduze kwezintaba zaseLubombo, ezigodini zaseZululand, okufinyeleleka kalula ezikhungweni zomngcele waseSwaziland. Kwakuyingxenye ye-panhandle yaseTransvaal phakathi kwePhongolo (I-Natal) ISwaziland (manje eyi-Eswatini) kwaze kwaba ngo-1994, lapho idluliselwa eKwaZulu-Natal.

english_source: Mbalula rose to national political prominence as the President of the ANC Youth League between 2004 and 2008. During this period, he became an outspoken supporter of Jacob Zuma, whom he supported at the ANC's 2007 Polokwane conference. At the same conference, he was elected to the ANC National Executive Committee for the first time and became the party's head of elections and organisation, in which capacity he coordinated its campaign in the 2009 general election. He continued to play a central role in the ANC's subsequent election campaigns.
target1_text: UMbalula waduma kwezombusazwe kazwelonke njengoMongameli we-I-ANC Youth League kusuka ngo 2004 kuya ku-2008. Phakathi nalesi sikhathi, waba umsekeli oqondile ka Jacob Zuma, amsekela engqungqutheleni ye-ANC ngo-2007 ePolokwane. Engqungqutheleni efanayo, wakhethwa ukuba abe seKomidini Ebusayo Kazwelonke ye-ANC okokuqala ,futhi waba yinhloko yeqembu yokhetho nokuhleleka, lapho ahlela khona umkhankaso wayo okhethweni lukazwelonke ngo-2009. Waqhubeka nokudlala indima ebalulekile emikhankasweni yokhetho yeANCkazw eyalandela.
target2_text: UMbalula waduma kwezombusazwe kazwelonke njengoMongameli we-I-ANC Youth League phakathi kuka-2004 no-2008. Phakathi nalesi sikhathi, waba umsekeli oqondile UJacob Zuma, amsekela engqungqutheleni ye-ANC ka-2007 ePolokwane. Engqungqutheleni efanayo, wakhethwa ukuba abe seKomitini Ebusayo Kazwelonke ye-ANC okokuqala futhi waba yinhloko yeqembu yokhetho nokuhleleka, lapho ahlela khona umkhankaso wayo okhethweni lukazwelonke luka-2009. Waqhubeka nokudlala indima ebalulekile emikhankasweni yokhetho ye-ANC eyalandela.

english_source: Mbongeni Ngema was born on 10 May 1955[1][lower-alpha 1] in Verulam, Natal (near Durban), the third of seven children of Gladys Hadebe and Zwelikhethabantu Ngema. Zwelikhethabantu was a policeman who had been born in the village of eNhlwathi, in kwaHlabisa, outside Mtubatuba, and was stationed at Verulam. This was a predominantly Indian area, but there were many Black residents too. After the 1950 Group Areas Act, Verulam was reclassified for Indians only, so black Africans were relocated, including the policeman's children, to kwaHlabisa, to live with their grandfather. There Mbongeni and his siblings lived a rural life, getting up early to tend to the animals before school, which he attended until Standard Six.[2]
target1_text: UMbongeni Ngema wazalwa ngo-10 Meyi 1955[1][lower-alpha 1] eVerulam, eNatal (eduzane neDurban), ingane yesithathu ezinganeni eziyisikhombisa zikaGladys Hadebe noZwelikhethabantu Ngema. UZwelikhethabantu wayeyiphoyisa elazalelwa edolobhaneni lase-Nhlwathi, ekwaHlabisa, ngaphandle kweMtubatuba, futhi lalibekwe eVerulam. Lena kwakuyindawo enabantu abaningi abangAmaNdiya, kodwa kwakukhona nezakhamuzi eziningi zabansundu. Ngemuva kwe-Group Areas Act ka-1950, i-Verulam yahlukaniswa kabusha ngamaNdiya kuphela, ngakho-ke abantu abansundu base-Afrika bathunyelwa kwenye indawo, kuhlanganise nezingane zamaphoyisa, baya e-kwaHlabisa, ukuze bahlale nomkhulu wabo. Lapho, uMbongeni nezingane zakubo baphila impilo yasemaphandleni, besuka besebancane ukuze banakekele izilwane ngaphambi kwesikole, lapho afunda khona kwaze kwaba yi-Standard Six.[2]

english_source: Parktown is a wealthy suburb of Johannesburg, South Africa, and is the first suburb north of the inner city (both chronologically and geographically). It is affectionately known as one of the Parks, others including Parkview, Parkwood, Westcliff, Parktown North, Parkhurst and Forest Town. Parktown is one of Johannesburg's largest suburbs, neighbouring Hillbrow, Braamfontein and Milpark to the South; Berea and Houghton to the East; Killarney and Forest Town to the North, and Westcliff, Melville and Richmond to the West. Originally established by the Randlords in the 1890s, Parktown is now home to many businesses, hospitals, schools, churches and restaurants, whilst still maintaining quiet residential areas. It is also home to three of the five campuses of the University of the Witwatersrand including the education campus, medical school and Wits Business School. It is located in Region F of the City of Johannesburg Metropolitan Municipality.
target1_text: IParktown iyindawo ecebile yaseGoli, INingizimu Afrika, futhi iyindawo yokuqala esenyakatho yedolobha elingaphakathi (ngokulandelana kwezikhathi nangokwendawo). Yaziwa ngothando njengenye yamaPaki, amanye ahlanganisa iParkview, IParkwood, I-Westcliff, IParktown North, IParkhurst neForest Town. IParktown ingenye yamadolobhana amakhulu aseGoli, engumakhelwane we-Hillbrow, IBraamfontein I-Milpark eningizimu; IBerea ne-Houghton empumalanga; IKillarney neForest Town enyakatho, I-Westcliff, IMelville IRichmond entshonalanga. I-Parktown, eyasungulwa yi-Randlords ngawo-1890, manje isiyikhaya lamabhizinisi amaningi, izibhedlela, izikole, amasonto kanye nezindawo zokudlela, yize kunjalo isagcina izindawo zokuhlala ezinokuthula. Iphinde ibe yikhaya lamakhempasi amathathu kwayisihlanu e-University of the Witwatersrand kuhlanganise nekhempasi lemfundo, Isikole sezokwelapha kanye ne-Wits Business School. Itholakala eSifundeni F seDolobha laseGoli Metropolitan Municipality.

Yaziwa ngothando njengenye yAmapaki, amanye ahlanganisa iParkview, IParkwood, I-Westcliff, IParktown North, IParkhurst neForest Town. Itholakala eSifundeni F seDolobha laseGoli Metropolitan Municipality.

english_source: Pregnant teenagers face many of the same pregnancy-related issues as older women.[8][9] Teenagers are more likely to experience pregnancy complications or maternal death than women aged 20 or older. There are additional concerns for those under the age of 15 as they are less likely to be physically developed to sustain a healthy pregnancy or to give birth.[10] For girls aged 15–19, risks are associated more with socioeconomic factors than with the biological effects of age.[11] Risks of low birth weight, premature labor, anemia, and pre-eclampsia are not connected to biological age by the time a girl is 16, as they are not observed in births to older teens after controlling for other risk factors, such as access to high-quality prenatal care.[12][13]
target1_text: Intsha ekhulelwe ibhekana nezinkinga eziningi ezifanayo zokukhulelwa njengabesifazane abadala.[5][6] Intsha inamathuba amaningi okubhekana nezinkinga zokukhulelwa noma ukufa komama kunabesifazane abaneminyaka engu-20 noma ngaphezulu. Kukhona ukukhathazeka okwengeziwe kulabo abangaphansi kweminyaka engu-15 njengoba bengenakuthuthuka ngokomzimba ukuze bakhulelwe kahle noma babebelethise.[7] Emantombazaneni aneminyaka engu-15-19, izingozi zihlobene kakhulu nezici zezenhlalo nezomnotho kunemiphumela yezinto eziphilayo yobudala.[8] Izingozi isisindo esiphansi sokuzalwa, Ukubeletha ngaphambi kwesikhathi, i-anemia, kanye ne-pre-eclampsia azihlangene iminyaka engokwemvelo ngesikhathi intombazane ineminyaka engu-16, njengoba zingabonwa ekuzalweni kwentsha esezikhulile ngemuva kokulawula ezinye izici zobungozi, njengokufinyelela ekunakekelweni okuphezulu kwangaphambi kokubeletha.[9][10]
