english_source: Zakhele Madida (born 26 May 1981 in KwaMashu F-section, KwaZulu-Natal), known professionally as Zakes Bantwini, is a South African singer, record producer and businessman.[1][2]
target1_text: UZakhele Madida (owazalwa zinga-26 kuNhlaba wezi-1981 KwaMashu F-section, KwaZulu-Natal), owaziwa ngokuthi UZakes Bantwini, ungumculi waseNingizimu Afrika, ungu mkhiqizi we-rekhodi futhi ungusomabhizinisi.[1][2]
target2_text: UZakhele Madida (owazalwa ngo-26 Meyi 1981 eKwaMashu F-section, KwaZulu-Natal), owaziwa ngokuthi UZakes Bantwini, ungumculi waseNingizimu Afrika, umkhiqizi we-rekhodi futhi usomabhizinisi.[1][2]

english_source: Do Make Say Think is a Canadian instrumental band formed in Toronto, Ontario in 1995. Their music combines jazz-style drumming, distorted guitars and wind instruments, and prominent bass guitar.
target1_text: I-Do Make Say Think yiqembu le-instrumental laseCanada elakhiwa IToronto, e-I-Ontario ngo-1995. Umculo wabo uhlanganisa isigubhu sesitayela se-i-jazz, iziginci ezonakele Izinsimbi zomoya, kanye nesiginci se-bass esivelele.
target2_text: I-Do Make Say Think yiqembu le-zinsimbi zomuculo laseCanada elakhiwa IToronto, e-I-Ontario ngo-1995. Umculo wabo uhlanganisa isigubhu sesitayela se-i-jazz, iziginci ezonakele Izinsimbi zomoya, kanye nesiginci se-bass esivelele.

english_source: The ripe fruit varies according to cultivar in size, shape, color, sweetness, and eating quality.[4] Depending on the cultivar, fruits are variously yellow, orange, red, or green.[4] The fruit has a single flat, oblong pit that can be fibrous or hairy on the surface and does not separate easily from the pulp.[4] The fruits may be somewhat round, oval, or kidney-shaped, ranging from 5–25 centimetres (2–10 in) in length and from 140 grams (5 oz) to 2 kilograms (5 lb) in weight per individual fruit.[4] The skin is leather-like, waxy, smooth, and fragrant, with colors ranging from green to yellow, yellow-orange, yellow-red, or blushed with various shades of red, purple, pink, or yellow when fully ripe.[4]
target1_text: Isithelo esivuthiwe siyahlukahluka kuye ngohlobo ngobukhulu, ukuma, umbala, ubumnandi, kanye nekhwalithi yokudla.[8] Kuye ngohlobo, izithelo zinombala ophuzi, osawolintshi, obomvu, noma oluhlaza.[8] Isithelo sinomgodi owodwa oyisicaba, omude ongaba Imicu noma onoboya ebusweni futhi ongahlukaniseki kalula ne-pulp.[8] Izithelo zingaba yindilinga, zibe yindilinga, noma zibe nesimo izinso, zisukela kumasentimitha angu-5-25 (2-10 ubude futhi zisukela kumagremu angu-140 (5 kuya kumakhilogremu angu-2 (5 ngesisindo sesithelo ngasinye.[8] Isikhumba sifana nesikhumba, sinamafutha, sibushelelezi, futhi sinamakha, ngemibala esukela koluhlaza kuya kophuzi, ophuzi-olintshi, ophuze-obomvu, noma egqamile ngemibala ehlukahlukene ebomvu, onsomi, obomvana, noma ephuzi lapho ivuthiwe ngokuphelele.[8]
target2_text: Isithelo esivuthiwe siyahlukahluka kuye ngohlobo ngobukhulu, ukuma, umbala, ubumnandi, kanye nekhwalithi yokudla.[8] Kuye ngohlobo, izithelo zinombala ophuzi, osawolintshi, obomvu, noma oluhlaza.[8] Isithelo sinomgodi owodwa oyisicaba, omude ongaba Imicu noma onoboya ebusweni futhi ongahlukaniseki kalula nezinye izithelo.[8] Izithelo zingaba yindilinga, noma zibe nesimo sezinso zisukela kumasentimitha angu-5-25 (2-10 ubude futhi zisukela kumagremu angu-140 (5 kuya kumakhilogremu angu-2 (5 ngesisindo sesithelo ngasinye.[8] Isikhumba sifana nesikhumba, sinamafutha, sibushelelezi, futhi sinamakha, ngemibala esukela koluhlaza kuya kophuzi, ophuzi-olintshi, ophuzi-obomvu, noma egqamile ngemibala ehlukahlukene ebomvu, onsomi, obomvana, noma ephuzi lapho ivuthiwe ngokuphelele.[8]

english_source: Mango trees grow to 30–40 metres (98–131 feet) tall, with a crown radius of 10–15 m (33–49 ft). The trees are long-lived, as some specimens still fruit after 300 years.[11]
target1_text: Izihlahla zikhula zibe ngamamitha angu-30-40 (98-131 ubude, kanye nomqhele ongamamitha angu-10-15 (33-49 ft). Lezi zihlahla ziphila isikhathi eside, njengoba ezinye izihlahla zisazithelo ngemuva kweminyaka engama-300.[7]
target2_text: Izihlahla zikhula zibe ngamamitha angu-30-40 (98-131 ubude, kanye nomqhele ongamamitha angu-10-15 (33-49 ft). Lezi zihlahla ziphila isikhathi eside, njengoba ezinye izihlahla zisazithelo ngemuva kweminyaka engama khulu amathathu.[7]

english_source: Stanton "Stiga" Fredericks (born 13 June 1978) is a South African former association football player who played as midfielder and has represented South Africa. Stanton retired from football in May 2013.
target1_text: UStanton "Stiga" Fredericks (owazalwa ngo-13 June 1978) ungumdlali ibhola likanobhutshuzwayo waseNingizimu Afrika owayedlala njengomdlali ophakathi nendawo futhi emele INingizimu Afrika. UStanton wathatha umhlalaphansi ebhola likanobhutshuzwayo ngoMeyi 2013.
target2_text: UStanton "Stiga" Fredericks (owazalwa ngo-13 ku-Nhlangulana 1978) ungumdlali webhola likanobhutshuzwayo waseNingizimu Afrika owayedlala njengomdlali ophakathi nendawo futhi emele INingizimu Afrika. UStanton wathatha umhlalaphansi ebholeni likanobhutshuzwayo ku-Nhlaba 2013.[1]

english_source: Fredericks previously had a loan spell at Supersport United.[1] He also spent three seasons with FC Moscow, appearing in 13 Russian Premier League matches.[2]
target1_text: Ngaphambilini uFrederick wayebolekwe I-Supersport United.[2] Uphinde wachitha izinkathi ezintathu ne-FC Moscow, wavela emidlalweni engu-13 ye-Russian Premier League.[3][4]
target2_text: UFredericks ngaphambili wayebolekwe I-Supersport United.[2] Uphinde wachitha izinkathi ezintathu ne-I-FC Moscow, wavela emidlalweni engu-13 ye-I-Russian Premier League.[3]

english_source: Zuma was born in the rural region of Nkandla, which is now part of the KwaZulu-Natal province and the centre of Zuma's support base. He joined the ANC at the age of 17 in 1959 and spent ten years in Robben Island Prison as a political prisoner. He went into exile in 1975 and was ultimately appointed head of the ANC's intelligence department. After the ANC was unbanned in 1990, he quickly rose through the party's national leadership and became deputy secretary general in 1991, national chairperson in 1994, and deputy president in 1997. He was the deputy president of South Africa from 1999 to 2005 under President Thabo Mbeki, Nelson Mandela's successor. Mbeki dismissed Zuma on 14 June 2005 after Zuma's financial adviser, Schabir Shaik, was convicted of making corrupt payments to Zuma in connection with the Arms Deal. Zuma was charged with corruption and was also acquitted on rape charges in the highly publicised 2006 trial. He managed to retain the support of a left-wing coalition inside the ANC, which allowed him to remove Mbeki as ANC president in December 2007 at the ANC's Polokwane elective conference.
target1_text: UZuma wazalelwa esifundeni sasemaphandleni saseNkandla, manje esiyingxenye yesifundazwe saKwaZulu-Natal futhi esikhungweni sokusekela uZuma. Wajoyina i-ANC eneminyaka engu-17 ngo-1959 futhi wachitha iminyaka eyishumi ejele LaseRobben Island njengesiboshwa sezombusazwe. Waya ekudingisweni ngo-1975 futhi ekugcineni wamiswa njengenhloko yomnyango wobunhloli we-ANC. Ngemva kokuba i-ANC ingavinjelwe ngo-1990, ngokushesha wakhuphuka ebuholini bezwe futhi waba yiphini likanobhala-jikelele ngo-1991, usihlalo kazwelonke ngo-1994, nephini likamongameli ngo-1997. Wayeyiphini likamongameli waseNingizimu Afrika kusukela ngo-1999 kuya ku-2005 ngaphansi kukaMongameli UThabo Mbeki, owalandela UNelson Mandela. U-Mbeki waxosha u-Zuma ngo-14 June 2005 ngemuva kokuba umeluleki wezezimali kaZuma, UShabir Shaik, egwetshwe ngecala lokukhokhela inkhohlakalo ka-Zuma maqondana nesivumelwano sezikhali. UZuma wamangalelwe ngenkohlakalo futhi kanye namacala okudlwengula ecaleni lika-2006 elaziwa kakhulu. Wakwazi ukugcina ukusekelwa komfelandawonye wangakwesobunxele ngaphakathi kwe-ANC, okwamvumela ukuba asuse uMbeki njengomongameli we-ANC ngoDisemba 2007 engqungqutheleni yokukhetha ye-ANC ePolokwane.
target2_text: UZuma wazalelwa esifundeni sasemaphandleni saseNkandla, manje esiyingxenye yesifundazwe saseKwaZulu-Natal futhi esikhungweni sokusekela uZuma. Wajoyina i-ANC eneminyaka engu-17 ngo-1959 futhi wachitha iminyaka eyishumi Ijele LaseRobben Island njengesiboshwa sezombusazwe. Waya ekudingisweni ngo-1975 futhi ekugcineni wamiswa njengenhloko yomnyango wobunhloli we-ANC. Ngemva kokuba i-ANC ingavinjelwe ngo-1990, ngokushesha wakhuphuka ebuholini bezwe futhi waba yiphini likanobhala-jikelele ngo-1991, usihlalo kazwelonke ngo-1994, nephini likamongameli ngo-1997. Wayeyiphini likamongameli waseNingizimu Afrika kusukela ngo-1999 kuya ku-2005 ngaphansi kukaMongameli UThabo Mbeki, owalandela UNelson Mandela. U-Mbeki waxosha u-Zuma ngo-14 June 2005 ngemuva kokuba umeluleki wezezimali kaZuma, UShabir Shaik, egwetshwe ngecala lokukhokha inkhohlakalo ku-Zuma maqondana ne-Arms Deal. UZuma bamangalelwe ngenkohlakalo futhi wakhululwa namacala okudlwengula ecaleni lika-2006 elaziwa kakhulu. Wakwazi ukugcina ukusekelwa komfelandawonye wangakwesobunxele ngaphakathi kwe-ANC, okwamvumela ukuba asuse uMbeki njengomongameli we-ANC ngoDisemba 2007 engqungqutheleni yokukhetha ye-ANC ePolokwane.

english_source: In 2004 Benedict Cumberbatch and two friends were kidnapped by 6 armed men near St Lucia, KwaZulu-Natal. Benedict only spoke publicly about it in July 2009 at an interview for a book launched by the Prince's Trust and Starbucks.[5]
target1_text: Ngo-2004 UBenedict Cumberbatch nabangane ababili bathunjwa amadoda ayisithupha ahlomile eduze kwaseSt Lucia, eKwaZulu-Natal. UBenedict wakhuluma obala kuphela ngakho ngoJulayi 2009 engxoxweni yencwadi eyasungulwa yiPrince's Trust ne-Starbucks.[5]
target2_text: Ngo-2004 UBenedict Cumberbatch nabangani bakhe ababili bathunjwa amadoda ayisithupha ahlomile eduze kwase St Lucia, KwaZulu-Natal. UBenedict wakhuluma ngokusobala ngakho kuphela ngoNtulikazi 2009 engxoxweni yencwadi eyasungulwa yiPrince's Trust ne-Starbucks.[5]

english_source: Harmful bullying behavior can include posting rumors, threats, sexual remarks, a victims' personal information, or hate speech.[4] Bullying or harassment can be identified by repeated behavior and an intent to harm.[5] Tactics can also include creating or posting on fake profiles to create anonymity to spread harmful messages.[citation needed]
target1_text: Ukuziphatha okuxhaphazayo kungahlanganisa ukuthumela amahemuhemu, izinsongo, izinkulumo zobulili, Ulwazi lomuntu siqu lwezisulu, noma Inkulumo yenzondo.[4] Ukuhlukunyezwa noma ukuhlukunyezwa kungabonakala ngokuziphatha okuphindaphindiwe nenhloso yokulimaza.[5] Amaqhinga angaphinde ahlanganise ukudala noma ukuthumela kumaphrofayili omgunyathi ukudala ukungaziwa ukuze kusakazwe imiyalezo elimazayo.   [citation needed]
target2_text: Ukuziphatha okuxhaphazayo kungahlanganisa ukuthumela amahemuhemu, izinsongo, izinkulumo zobulili, Ulwazi lomuntu siqu sakhe, noma Inkulumo yenzondo.[4] Ukuhlukunyezwa noma ukuhlumeza kungabonakala ngokuziphatha okuphindaphindiwe nenhloso yokulimaza.[5] Amaqhinga angaphinde ahlanganise ukudala noma ukuthumela kumaphrofayili omgunyathi ukudala ukungaziwa ukuze kusakazwe imiyalezo elimazayo.   [citation needed]

english_source: Cyberbullying is in many cases an extension of already existing traditional bullying.[6][7] Students who are bullied via the Internet have, in most cases, also been bullied in other more traditional ways before (e.g., physically or verbally). There are few students who are bullied exclusively over the Internet; these cyber victims are often physically stronger students, which causes bullies to prefer online confrontations over face–to–face contact at school.[6]
target1_text: Ukuhlukunyezwa ezimweni eziningi kuwukwandiswa kokuhlukunyezwa okungokwesiko okukhona kakade.[6][7] Abafundi abahlukunyezwa nge-Intanethi, ezimweni eziningi, nabo bahlukunyezwa ngezinye izindlela ezingokwesiko ngaphambili (isibonelo, ngokomzimba noma ngamazwi). Kunabantwana abambalwa abahlukunyezwa kuphela nge-Intanethi; lezi zinsolo zokuhlukunyezwa zivame ukuba abafundi abanamandla ngokomzimba, okubangela abahlukumezi ukuthi bakhethe izingxabano eziku-inthanethi kunokuxhumana ubuso nobuso esikoleni.[6]
target2_text: Ukuhlukunyezwa nge-cyber ezimweni eziningi kuwukwandiswa kokuhlukunyezwa okungokwesiko okukhona kakade.[6][7] Abafundi abahlukunyezwa nge-Intanethi, ezimweni eziningi, nabo bahlukunyezwa ngezinye izindlela ezingokwesiko ngaphambili (isib, ngokomzimba noma ngamazwi). Kunabantwana abambalwa abahlukunyezwa kuphela nge-Intanethi; lezi zisulu ze-cyber zivame ukuba abafundi abanamandla ngokomzimba, okubangela abahlukumezi ukuthi bakhethe izingxabano eziku-inthanethi kunokuxhumana ubuso nobuso esikoleni.[6]

english_source: The meme originated from a TikTok video published by Screenshot HQ in April 2024 which interviewed eight women on the question, with seven out of them picking the bear.[1] The post went viral and gained over 16 million views in two months.[2][3]
target1_text: I-meme yavela ku-video ye-I-TikTok eyanyatheliswa yi-Screenshot HQ ngo-Ephreli 2024 eyaxoxa nabesifazane abayisishiyagalombili ngalo mbuzo, abayisikhombisa babo bakhetha ibhele.[1] I-post yaba yimpaphe futhi yathola ukubukelwa okungaphezu kwezigidi ezingu-16 ezinyangeni ezimbili.[2][3]
target2_text: Le-meme yasukela ku-video ye-TikTok eyanyatheliswa yi-Screenshot HQ ngo-Mbasa 2024 eyaxoxa nabesifazane abayisishiyagalombili ngalo mbuzo, abayisikhombisa babo bakhetha ibhele.[1] I-post yaba yimpaphe futhi yathola ukubukelwa okungaphezu kwezigidi ezingu-16 ezinyangeni ezimbili.[2][3]

english_source: Some journalists compared the response of women sharing their assault experiences online with the #MeToo movement.[5][10] Femi Oluwole of The Independent argued that the debate showed that men need to be more informed about the dangers women face in society.[11] Journalists highlighted various murder cases such as Grace Millane's and Futura Junko's.[11][12]
target1_text: Ezinye zezintatheli zafanisa ukusabela kwabesifazane abahlanganyela okuhlangenwe nakho kwabo kokuhlasela ku-inthanethio nenhlangano ye-#MeToo.[5][10] U-Femi Oluwole we-Independent waphikelela ngokuthi inkulumo-mpikiswano yabonisa ukuthi amadoda ayaludinga ulwazi ngezingozi abesifazane ababhekana nazo emphakathini.[11] Izintatheli zaveza amacala ahlukahlukene okubulala afana nelika-Grace Millane kanye no-Futura Junko.[11][12]
target2_text: Ezinye izintatheli zafanisa ukusabela kwabesifazane abahlanganyela okuhlangenwe nakho kwabo kokuhlasela ku-inthanethi nenhlangano ye-#MeToo.[5][10] U-Femi Oluwole we-Independent waphikelela ngokuthi inkulumo-mpikiswano yabonisa ukuthi amadoda adinga ukwazi okwengeziwe ngezingozi abesifazane ababhekana nazo emphakathini.[11] Izintatheli zaveza amacala ahlukahlukene okubulala afana UGrace Millane's I-Futura Junko.[11][12]

english_source: Rachel Ulatowski of the feminist magazine The Mary Sue called men's backlash to women picking the bear "bizarre" and "laughable" due to weak arguments with misused statistics and claims of misandry.[8] Some journalists compared it to the #NotAllMen meme.[10][6] Clarissa-Jan Lim of MSNBC argued that discussion focusing on the actual hostility of bears misses the point, which she said was the "dangers that women experience in [a] world" with men.[7]
target1_text: URachel Ulatowski we-feminist magazine i-UMary Sue wabiza ukusabela kwamadoda kwabesifazane abakhetha ibhele ngokuthi "okuyinqaba" futhi "okuhlekisayo" ngenxa yezimpikiswano ezibuthakathaka ngezibalo ezisetshenziswa kabi kanye nezimangalo ze-misandry.[8] Ezinye izintatheli zaziqhathanisa ne-#NotAllMen meme.[10][6] UClarissa-Jan Lim we-I-MSNBC waphikelela ngokuthi ingxoxo egxile enzondweni yangempela yamabhere iphuthelwa iphuzu, athi "izingozi abesifazane ababhekana nazo ezweni namadoda.[7][a]
target2_text: URachel Ulatowski wephephandaba lezokukhuluma i-UMary Sue wabiza ukusabela kwamadoda ngemibono yabesifazane abakhetha ibhele ngokuthi "okuyinqaba" futhi "okuhlekisayo" ngenxa yezimpikiswano ezibuthakathaka ngezibalo ezisetshenziswa kabi kanye nezimangalo ze-misandry.[8] Ezinye izintatheli zaziqhathanisa ne-#NotAllMen meme.[10][6] UClarissa-Jan Lim we-I-MSNBC waphikelela ngokuthi ingxoxo egxile enzondweni yangempela yamabhele iphuthelwa iphuzu, wase ethi "izingozi abesifazane ababhekana nazo ezweni namadoda.[7][a]

english_source: Later in July, the influencer Amanda Wylie shared a video to TikTok about her encounter with a bear in the woods. She compared it to the "man or bear" meme, saying she would still "choose the bear".[15][16] In addition, the influencer Sir Carter referenced the meme in the most viral LGBT TikTok of mid-2024.[17]
target1_text: Kamuva ngoJulayi, onethonya u-Amanda Wylie wabelana nge-video ku-TikTok mayelana nokuhlangana kwakhe nebhere ehlathini. Wayichathanisa ne-meme "umuntu noma ibhele", ethi usazo "khetha ibhele".[15][16] Ngaphezu kwalokho, onethonya uSir Carter wabhekisela ku-meme kuyi-TikTok evame kakhulu ye-LGBT maphakathi no-2024.[17]
target2_text: Kamuva ngo-Ntulikazi, onomthelela u-Amanda Wylie wabelana nge-video ku-TikTok mayelana nokuhlangana kwakhe nebhele ehlathini. Wayiqhathanisa ne-meme "owesilisa noma ibhele", ethi usazo "khetha ibhele".[15][16] Ngaphezu kwalokho, onomthelela uSir Carter wabhekisela ku-meme kuyi-TikTok evame kakhulu ye-LGBT maphakathi no-2024.[17]

english_source: A former forward, McCarthy is the South Africa national team's all-time top scorer with 31 goals.[5] He is also the only South African to have won the UEFA Champions League, doing so with Porto in 2003–04.
target1_text: Owayengumdlali wezemidlalo, uMcCarthy ungumdlali Iqembu lesizwe laseNingizimu Afrika onemigomo engu-31.[3] Uphinde abe ukuphela komuntu waseNingizimu Afrika owanqoba I-UEFA Champions League, enza kanjalo ne-I-Porto ngo-2003-04.
target2_text: Owayengumdlali wezemidlalo, uMcCarthy ungumdlali Iqembu lesizwe laseNingizimu Afrika onemigomo engu-31.[3] Uphinde abe ukuphela komuntu waseNingizimu Afrika owanqoba I-UEFA Champions League, enza kanjalo ne-I-Porto ngonyaka ka-2003. uMgadli ovelele uMc Carthy

english_source: McCarthy was born in Cape Town and grew up in Hanover Park in the Cape Flats,[6] an area notorious for its high unemployment rate and gang violence. He is the son of Dudley and Dora McCarthy and has two brothers and a sister.[7] His older brother is Jerome McCarthy, a former professional footballer who played for Kaizer Chiefs and Manning Rangers, among other clubs, while his younger brother Mark played football at Franklin Pierce University in the United States.[7]
target1_text: U-McCarthy wazalelwa IKapa futhi wakhulela IHanover Park eCape Flats, indawo edume ngezinga eliphakeme lokuntuleka kwemisebenzi nobudlova bamaqembu.[4] Oyindodana kaDudley noDora McCarthy futhi unezelamani ezimbili nodadewabo.[5] Umfowabo omdala ng u-UJerome McCarthy, owayengumdlali webhola likanobhutshuzwayo oqeqeshiwe owayedlala iqembu iKaizer Chiefs neManning Rangers, phakathi kwamanye amaqembu, ngenkathi umfowabo omncane uMark edlala ibhola likanobhuthuzwayo I-Franklin Pierce University e-United States.[5]
target2_text: U-McCarthy wazalelwa IKapa futhi wakhulela IHanover Park eCape Flats, indawo edume ngezinga eliphakeme lokuntuleka kwemisebenzi nobudlova bamaqembu.[4] Uyindodana kaDudley noDora McCarthy futhi unezelamani ezimbili nodadewabo.[5] Umfowabo omdala ngUJerome McCarthy, owayengumdlali webhola likanobhutshuzwayo oqeqeshiwe owayedlala iKaizer Chiefs neManning Rangers, phakathi kwamanye amaqembu, ngenkathi umfowabo omncane uMark edlala ibhola likanobhuthuzwayo I-Franklin Pierce University e-United States.[5]

english_source: Playing for Seven Stars, the 18-year-old McCarthy scored 1 goal in 29 matches in the 1995–96 season, followed by another 12 goals in 20 matches, which earned him a transfer to Cape Town Spurs, which two years later merged with Seven Stars to form Dutch club Ajax's feeder team, Ajax Cape Town.
target1_text: Edlala i-Seven Stars, u-McCarthy oneminyaka engu-18 ubudala wafaka igoli elilodwa emidlalweni engu-29 enkathini ka-1995-96, kwalandelwa amanye imigomo engu-12 emidlalwa engu-20, okwamenza wathunyelwa eKapa Town Spurs, eminyakeni emibili kamuva ehlanganiswa ne-Seven Star ukuze yakhe iqembu le-Ajax laseDashi, I-Ajax Cape Town.
target2_text: Uke wadlalela i-Seven Stars, u-McCarthy oneminyaka engu-18 ubudala wafaka igoli elilodwa emidlalweni engu-29 enkathini ka-1995-96, kwalandelwa amanye imigomo engu-12 emidlalwa engu-20, okwamenza wathunyelwa eKapa Town Spurs, eminyakeni emibili kamuva ehlanganiswa ne-Seven Star ukuze yakhe iqembu le-Ajax laseDashi, I-Ajax Cape Town.

english_source: Following the death of his father, King Sekwati, on 20 September 1861, Sekhukhune successfully defended his right to the throne against his half-brother Mampuru II and heir apparent with the support of his Matuba regiment. Despite his victory, Sekhukhune adhered to the serota tradition and allowed Mampuru to peacefully leave the Bapedi territory. His other known siblings were; Legolwana,[2] Johannes Dinkwanyane, and Kgoloko.[3] Sekhukhune married Legoadi IV in 1862, and lived on a mountain, now known as Thaba Leolo or Leolo Mountains,[4] which he fortified. To strengthen his kingdom and guard against European colonization, he had his young subjects work in white mines and on farms so that their salaries could be used to buy guns from the Portuguese in Delagoa Bay, as well as livestock.
target1_text: Ngemuva kokushona kukayise, INkosi uSekwati, ngo-20 September 1861, uSekhukhune wavikela ngokuphumelelayo ilungelo lakhe lesihlalo sobukhosi ngokumelene nomfowabo ngomzali oyedwa IMampuru II nendlalifa ebonakalayo ngokusekelwa kwebutho lakhe laseMatuba. Naphezu kokunqoba kwakhe, uSekhhune wanamathela esikweni lama-serota futhi wavumela uMampuru ukuba ashiye ngokuthula indawo yaseBapedi. Abanye abafowabo abaziwayo kwakuyi-Legolwana,[2] UJohannes Dinkwanyane, noKoloko.[3] USekhukhune washada noLegoadi IV ngo-1862, futhi wahlala entabeni, manje eyaziwa ngokuthi iThaba Leolo noma iLeolo Mountains,[4] ayiqinisa. Ukuze aqinise umbuso wakhe futhi avikele ekwakhiweni kwamakoloni aseYurophu, wenza ukuthi abantu bakhe abasebasha basebenze ezimayini ezimhlophe nasemapulazini ukuze amaholo abo asetshenziselwe ukuthenga izibhamu kumaPutukezi IDelagoa Bay, kanye nemfuyo.
target2_text: Ngemuva kokushona kukayise, INkosi uSekwati, ngo-20 September 1861, uSekhukhune wavikela ngokuphumelelayo ilungelo lakhe lesihlalo sobukhosi ngokumelene nomfowabo azalwa naye ngumzali oyedwa uMampuru II nendlalifa ebonakalayo ngokusekelwa kwebutho lakhe laseMatuba. Naphezu kokunqoba kwakhe, uSekhhune wanamathela esikweni lama-serota futhi wavumela uMampuru ukuba ashiye ngokuthula indawo yaseBapedi. Abanye abafowabo abaziwayo kwakungu Legolwana,[2] UJohannes Dinkwanyane, noKoloko.[3] USekhukhune washada noLegoadi IV ngo-1862, futhi wahlala entabeni, manje eyaziwa ngokuthi iThaba Leolo noma iLeolo Mountains,[4] ayiqinisa. Ukuze aqinise umbuso wakhe futhi avikele ekwakhiweni kwamakoloni aseYurophu, wenza ukuthi abantu bakhe abasebasha basebenze ezimayini ezimhlophe nasemapulazini ukuze amaholo abo asetshenziselwe ukuthenga izibhamu kumaPutukezi IDelagoa Bay, kanye nemfuyo.

english_source: The human immunodeficiency virus (HIV)[9][10][11] is a retrovirus[12] that attacks the immune system. It can be managed with treatment. Without treatment it can lead to a spectrum of conditions including acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (AIDS).[5]
target1_text: Igciwane lesandulelangculazi(HIV) [1][2][3] yi-retrovirus[4] ehlasela Isimiso sokuzivikela komzimba. Kungelashwa ngokwelashwa. Ngaphandle kokwelashwa kungaholela ezimweni ezihlukahlukene ezihlanganisa i-acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (AIDS).[5]
target2_text: Igciwane le-human immunodeficiency (HIV) [1][2][3] yi-retrovirus[4] ehlasela Isimiso sokuzivikela komzimba. Kungelashwa ngokwelashwa. Ngaphandle kokwelashwa kungaholela ezimweni ezihlukahlukene ezihlanganisa i-acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (AIDS).[5]

english_source: Human trafficking is condemned as a violation of human rights by international conventions, but legal protection varies globally. The practice has millions of victims around the world.[2][3]
target1_text: Ukushushumbiswa kwabantu kuchazwa njengokwephula kwamalungelo abantu ngezivumelwano zamazwe ngamazwe, kodwa ukuvikelwa kwezomthetho kuyehluka emhlabeni jikelele. Lo mkhuba unezigidi zezisulu emhlaben jikelele.[1][2]
target2_text: Ukushushumbiswa kwabantu kulahlwa njengokwephula amalungelo abantu ngezivumelwano zamazwe ngamazwe, kodwa ukuvikelwa okungokomthetho kuyahlukahluka emhlabeni wonke. Lo mkhuba unezigidi zezisulu emhlabeni wonke.[2][3]

english_source: Meyiwa was a goalkeeper of Orlando Pirates from 2005 as reserve goalkeeper to Francis Chansa until 2008. The arrival of new coach Milutin Sredojević at Pirates gave Meyiwa a debut against AmaZulu in a league match won 2–1 by The Bucs at Ellis Park on 8 November 2006.[5] But in 2008 when he was about to show his talent after depture of Francis Chansa to Engen Santos, Pirates brought Moeneeb Josephs from Wits University in 2008 and Meyiwa again had to be goalkeeper from the bench. But in 2012 season the interim coach Augusto Palacios gave Meyiwa some games by swiping him with Josephs, and the new coach of Pirates Roger De Sa gave Meyiwa a chance due to Josephs shoulder injury in 2012 season. Meyiwa showed his talent until he was picked for 2013 Africa Cup of Nations by then Bafana Bafana coach Gordon Igesund. Josephs wanted to leave Pirates in 2013 and he left Pirates to Bidvest Wits after seeing that he has no chance to play. Pirates brought Ghanaian first choice goalkeeper Fatau Dauda in 2013 season but Meyiwa continued to play and Dauda played only 3 games for Pirates and he left to Chippa United in 2014. Meyiwa is known for saving penalties in the Champions League 2013 against TP Mazembe in Lubumbashi, DRC when he saved two awarded penalties against Pirates which were both taken by then TP Mazembe captain Tresor Mputu and Pirates' then captain Lucky Lekgwathi was red carded in that match that which Pirates lost by 1-0 but Pirates won there by aggregate of 3–2, Meyiwa also saved another penalty in group stage match against Al Ahly in Cairo, Egypt that which was taken by Mohamed Aboutrika and Pirates won by 3–0, and Meyiwa also helped Pirates to go to the final against Al Ahly where Pirates were runners-up in the Final. Meyiwa was backed up by Brighton Mhlongo until his final kick of his game life in his final game against Ajax Cape Town F.C. in 2014 Telkom Knockout Quarter-final victory of 4–1 at Orlando Stadium on Saturday 25 October 2014, before his death on 26 October 2014 Sunday.
target1_text: UMeyiwa wayengumgcini webhola we-Orlando Pirates kusukela ngo-2005 njengomgcini webhala we-UFrancis Chansa kuze kube ngu-2008. Ukufika komqeqeshi omusha UMilutin Sredojević e-Pirates kwanikeza uMeyiwa ukuqala ukudlala ne-AmaZulu emdlalweni we-league owanqotshwa yi-2-1 yi-Bucs e-Ellis Park ngo-8 November 2006.[2] Kodwa ngo-2008 lapho esezobonisa ikhono lakhe ngemuva kokwehliswa kukaFrancis Chansa ku-Engen Santos, i-Pirates yaletha UMoeneeb UJosephs evela e-I-Wits University ngo-2008 futhi uMeyiwa waphinde kwadingeka ukuba abe ngumgcini webhodi ebhentshini. Kodwa ngenkathi ka-2012 umqeqeshi wesikhashana U-Augusto Palacios wanikeza uMeyiwa eminye imidlalo ngokumshaya noJosephs, futhi umqeqeshi omusha wePirates URoger De Sa wanikeza u-Meyiwa ithuba ngenxa yokulimala kwehlombe likaJosephs ngenkathi ka-2012. UMeyiwa wabonisa ikhono lakhe kwaze kwaba yilapho ekhethwa ku-2013 African Cup of Nations ngumqeqeshi we-Bafana Bafana UGordon Igesund. UJosephs wayefuna ukushiya iPirates ngo-2013 futhi washiya iPirats waya eBidvest Wits ngemuva kokubona ukuthi akanalo ithuba lokudlala. I-Pirates yaletha umgcini webhola wokuqala waseGhana U-Fatau Dauda ngenkathi ka-2013 kodwa uMeyiwa waqhubeka nokudlala futhi u-Davadda wadlala imidlalo emithathu kuphela ye-Pirats futhi washiya I-Chippa United ngo-2014. UMeyiwa waziwa ngokonga izinhlawulo e-I-Champions League 2013 ngokumelene U-TP Mazembe ULubumbashi, DRC lapho esindisa izinhlawulo ezimbili ezinikezwe i-Pirates ezazithathwe yi-TP Mazempe ngaleso sikhathi uTresor Mputu kanye nekaputeni we-Pirate wangaleso sikhathi uLucky Lekgwathi wabekwa i-Red card kulowo mdlalo lapho i-Piraates yahlulwa khona nge-3-2, uMeyiwa futhi yasindisa enye inhlawulo emdlalweni weqembu e-Ally Ahly ICairo, IGibithe, e-Pirats, e-Oper, futhi yawina i-Pyrates ngo-3-0 futhi yawina yi-Piratas. UMeyiwa wasekelwa yIBrighton Mhlongo kwaze kwaba yilapho eshaya okokugcina emdlalweni wakhe wokugcina ne-I-Ajax Cape Town F.C..C. ngo-2014 ukunqoba kwe-Telkom Knockout Quarter-final ngo-4-1 e-I-Orlando Stadium ngoMgqibelo 25 October 2014, ngaphambi kokufa kwakhe ngo-26 October 2014 ngeSonto.
target2_text: UMeyiwa wayengumgcini webhola we-Orlando Pirates kusukela ngo-2005 njengomgcini webhola we-UFrancis Chansa kuze kube ngu-2008. Ukufika komqeqeshi omusha UMilutin Sredojević e-Pirates kwanikeza uMeyiwa ukuqala ukudlala ne-AmaZulu emdlalweni we-league owanqotshwa yi-2-1 yi-Bucs e-Ellis Park mhla zi-8 kuLwezi 2006.[2] Kodwa ngo-2008 ilapho abonisa ikhono lakhe ngemuva kokwehliswa kukaFrancis Chansa ku-Engen Santos, i-Pirates yaletha UMoeneeb UJosephs evela e-I-Wits University ngo-2008 futhi uMeyiwa waphinde kwadingeka ukuba abe ngumgcini webhodi ebhentshini. Kodwa ngonyaka ka-2012 umqeqeshi wesikhashana U-Augusto Palacios wanikeza uMeyiwa eminye imidlalo ngokumshaya noJosephs, futhi umqeqeshi omusha wePirates URoger De Sa wanikeza u-Meyiwa ithuba ngenxa yokulimala kwehlombe likaJosephs ngenkathi ka-2012. UMeyiwa wabonisa ikhono lakhe kwaze kwaba yilapho ekhethwa ngo ngathi African Cup of Nations ngumqeqeshi we-Bafana Bafana UGordon Igesund. UJosephs wayefuna ukushiya iPirates ngo-2013 futhi washiya iPirats waya eBidvest Wits ngemuva kokubona ukuthi akanalo ithuba lokudlala. I-Pirates yaletha umgcini webhola wokuqala waseGhana U-Fatau Dauda ngenkathi ka-2013 kodwa uMeyiwa waqhubeka nokudlala futhi u-Davadda wadlala imidlalo emithathu kuphela ye-Pirats futhi washiya I-Chippa United ngo-2014. UMeyiwa waziwa ngokonga izinhlawulo e-I-Champions League 2013 ngokumelene U-TP Mazembe ULubumbashi, DRC lapho esindisa izinhlawulo ezimbili ezinikezwe i-Pirates ezazithathwe yi-TP Mazempe ngaleso sikhathi uTresor Mputu kanye nekaputeni we-Pirate wangaleso sikhathi uLucky Lekgwathi wabekwa i-Red card kulowo mdlalo lapho i-Piraates yahlulwa khona nge-3-2, uMeyiwa futhi yasindisa enye inhlawulo emdlalweni weqembu e-Ally Ahly ICairo, IGibithe, e-Pirats, e-Oper, futhi yawina i-Pyrates ngo-3-0 futhi yawina yi-Piratas. UMeyiwa wasekelwa yIBrighton Mhlongo kwaze kwaba yilapho eshaya okokugcina emdlalweni wakhe wokugcina ne-I-Ajax Cape Town F.C..C. ngo-2014 ukunqoba kwe-Telkom Knockout Quarter-final ngo-4-1 e-I-Orlando Stadium ngoMgqibelo 25 October 2014, ngaphambi kokufa kwakhe ngo-26 October 2014 ngeSonto.

english_source: The University of Pretoria (Afrikaans: Universiteit van Pretoria, Northern Sotho: Yunibesithi ya Pretoria) is a multi-campus public research university[11][12] in Pretoria, the administrative and de facto capital of South Africa.[13] The university was established in 1908 as the Pretoria campus of the Johannesburg-based Transvaal University College and is the fourth South African institution in continuous operation to be awarded university status. The university has grown from the original 32 students in a single late Victorian house to approximately 53,000 in 2019.[14] The university was built on seven suburban campuses on 1,190 hectares (2,900 acres).[9][10]
target1_text: I-University of IPretoria (Afrikaans: Universiteit van Pretoria, Northern Sotho: Yunibesithi ya Pretoria) iyunivesithi umphakathi yocwaningo olunamakamu amaningi[1][2] ePitoli, inhloko-dolobha yokuphatha nezenzakalo yaseNingizimu Afrika.[3] Le nyuvesi yasungulwa ngo-1908 njenge-campus yasePitoli ye-Transvaal University College eseGoli futhi iyisikhungo sesine saseNingizimu Afrika esisebenzayo esiqhubekayo sokunikezwa isikhundla saseyunivesithi. Inyuvesi ikhule isuka kubafundi bokuqala abangu-32 endlini eyodwa yaseVictoria yangemuva yaba cishe abangu-53,000 ngo-2019.[4] Inyuvesi yakhiwa emakamu ayisikhombisa angaphandle kwedolobha kumahektare angu-1,190 (amahektare angu-2,900).[5][6]
target2_text: I-University of IPretoria (Afrikaans: Universiteit van Pretoria, Northern Sotho: Yunibesithi ya Pretoria) iyunivesithi yocwaningo olunamakhampasi amaningi[1][2] ePitoli, inhloko-dolobha yokuphatha nezenzakalo yaseNingizimu Afrika.[3] Le nyuvesi yasungulwa ngonyaka ka-1908 njenge-khampasi yasePitoli ye-Transvaal University College eseGoli futhi iyisikhungo sesine saseNingizimu Afrika esisebenzayo esiqhubekayo sokunikezwa isikhundla saseyunivesithi. Inyuvesi ikhule isuka kubafundi bokuqala abangu-32 endlini eyodwa yaseVictoria yangemuva yaba cishe abangu-53,000 ngo-2019.[4] Inyuvesi yakhiwa emakamu ayisikhombisa angaphandle kwedolobha kumahektare angu-1,190 (amahektare angu-2,900).[5][6]

english_source: Connie Temweka Gabisile Chiume (5 June 1952 – 6 August 2024) was a South African actress and filmmaker.[1] She was known for her film roles in Black Panther, Black Is King and Blessers. On television, she appeared in S'gudi S'nyasi, Yizo Yizo 2, Zone 14, Rhythm City and Gomora.
target1_text: UConnie Temweka Gabisile Chiume (5 June 1952 - 6 August 2024) wayengumlingisi nomenzi wamabhayisikobho waseNingizimu Afrika.[1] Wayaziwa ngezingxenye zakhe zebhayisikobho kuBlack Panther, Black Is King ne-Blessers. kumabokakude, wavela ku-S'gudi S'nyasi, I-Yizo Yizo 2, Zone 14, i-Rhythm City neGomorrah.
target2_text: UConnie Temweka Gabisile Chiume (5 June 1952 - 6 August 2024) wayengumlingisi nomenzi wamabhayisikobho waseNingizimu Afrika.[1] Wayaziwa ngezingxenye zakhe zebhayisikobho ku-I-Black Panther, Black Is King ne-Blessers. Kuthelevishini, wavela ku-S'gudi S'nyasi, I-Yizo Yizo 2, Zone 14, Rhythm City and Gomorrah.

english_source: In 2006, she starred in the stage productions of You Strike The Woman and You Strike The Rock.[3] From 2007 to 2015, Chiume gained prominence through her role as Stella Moloi in the SABC1 drama series Zone 14, which earned her another SAFTA.[3] She also received the Award for the Best Supporting Actress in a Drama during the 3rd SAFTA. In 2015, she appeared in the soap opera Rhythm City as Mamokete Khuse.[1]
target1_text: Ngo-2006, wadlala indima eyinhloko emidlalweni yesiteji ye-You Strike The Woman ne-You Stride The Rock.[3] Kusukela ngo-2007 kuya ku-2015, uChiume wathola udumo ngendima yakhe njengoStella Moloi ochungechungeni lwe-drama ku-SABC1 i-Zone 14, eyamzuzela elinye i-SAFTA.[3] Uphinde wathola umklomelo we-Best Supporting Actress kwiDrama ngesikhathi seSiAFTA yesithathu. Ngo-2015, wavela kuyi-opera ye-soap Rhythm City njengoMamukete Khuse.[1]
target2_text: Ngo-2006, wadlala indima eyinhloko emidlalweni yesiteji ye-You Strike The Woman ne-You Stride The Rock.[3] Kusukela ngo-2007 kuya ku-2015, uChiume wathola udumo ngendima yakhe njengoStella Moloi ochungechungeni lwe-drama ye-I-SABC1 i-Zone 14, eyamzuzela elinye i-SAFTA.[3] Uphinde wathola umklomelo we-Best Supporting Actress in a Drama ngesikhathi se-3rd SAFTA. Ngo-2015, wavela kuyi-opera ye-soap Rhythm City njengoMamukete Khuse.[1]

english_source: The Trust Board is tasked with the responsibility of administering the Trust and Trust land for the benefit, material welfare and social well-being of the Zulu nation, who continue to occupy the land as they historically have done.[1] The Trust owns 29.67% of the land in KwaZulu-Natal, which is equivalent to 28,000 square kilometres, or 10,811 square miles.[2]
target1_text: I-Trust Board inomthwalo wemfanelo wokuphatha izwe le-Trust and Trust ngenzuzo, inhlalakahle yezinto ezibonakalayo nenhlalakahle yezenhlalo yesizwe samaZulu, abaqhubeka nokuhlala ezweni njengoba beyenze emlandweni.[1] I-Trust inendawo engu-29.67% eKwaZulu-Natal, elingana namakhilomitha-skwele angu-28,000, noma amakhilomitha-skhilomitha-skskwele angu-10,811.[2]
target2_text: I-Bhodi le Trust inomthwalo wemfanelo wokuphatha iSizwe samaZulu ngenzuzo, inhlalakahle yezinto ezibonakalayo nenhlalakahle yezenhlalo yesizwe samaZulu, abaqhubeka nokuhlala ezweni njengoba beyenze emlandweni.[1] I-Trust inendawo engu-29.67% eKwaZulu-Natal, elingana namakhilomitha-skwele angu-28,000, noma amakhilomitha-skhilomitha-skskwele angu-10,811.[2]

english_source: James Thabiso Monyane (born 30 April 2000) is a South African professional soccer player currently playing as a right-back for Orlando Pirates.
target1_text: UJames Thabiso Monyane (owazalwa ngo-30 April 2000) ungumdlali webhola likanobhutshuzwayo waseNingizimu Afrika njengamanje udlala njengomdlali wesokudla we-Orlando Pirates.
target2_text: UJames Thabiso Monyane (owazalwa ngo-30 kuMbasa 2000) ungumdlali webhola lezinyawo wase Ningizimu Afrika. Njengamanje udlala njengomdlali wesokudla kwiqembu le-OrlandoPirates.

english_source: At the youth international level he played in the 2016 COSAFA Under-17 Championship and the 2019 FIFA U-20 World Cup.[2][3]
target1_text: Ezindaweni zentsha yamazwe ngamazwe wadlala ngo-2016 COSAFA Under-17 Championship kanye ne-2019 FIFA U-20 World Cup.[1][2]
target2_text: Ezingeni lentsha yamazwe ngamazwe wadlala ku- 2016 COSAFA Under-17 Championship kanye ne -2019 FIFA U-20 World Cup . [1] [2]

english_source: Credited with creating a more intimate, confessional form of media communication,[13] Winfrey popularized and revolutionized[13][14] the tabloid talk show genre pioneered by Phil Donahue.[13] By the mid-1990s, Winfrey had reinvented her show with a focus on literature, self-improvement, mindfulness, and spirituality. Though she has been criticized for unleashing a confession culture, promoting controversial self-help ideas,[15] and having an emotion-centered approach,[16] she has also been praised for overcoming adversity to become a benefactor to others.[17] Winfrey also emerged as a political force in the 2008 presidential race, with her endorsement of Barack Obama estimated to have been worth about one million votes during the 2008 Democratic primaries.[18] In the same year, she formed her own network, the Oprah Winfrey Network (OWN). In 2013, Winfrey was awarded the Presidential Medal of Freedom by President Barack Obama.[19]
target1_text: Udunyiswa ngokwakha uhlobo oluseduze kakhulu, lokuvuma izono lokuxhumana kwemithombo yezindaba, Winfrey wathandwa futhi wagucula uhlobo lwe-tabloid talk show olwasungulwa nguPhil Donahue.[11][Maphakathi nawo-1990, uWinfrey wayesungule kabusha uhlelo lwakhe ngokugxila ezincwadini, ukuzithuthukisa, ukuqapha, nengokomoya. Nakuba egxekwa ngokudalula isiko lokuvuma izono, ukukhuthaza imibono Ukuzisiza eyimpikiswano, kanye nokuba nendlela egxile emizwelweni, kuye kwadunyiswa nangokunqoba ubunzima ukuze abe ngumsizi kwabanye.[12][13][14] U-Winfrey waphinde wavela njengamandla ezombusazwe emncintiswaneni wobumongameli ka-2008, ngokusekela kwakhe u-Barack Obama kulinganiselwa ukuthi kwakubiza amavoti angaba yisigidi esisodwa ngesikhathi sokhetho lwamaDemocratic lwango-2008.[15] Ngonyaka ofanayo, wakha inethiwekhi yakhe, i-Oprah Winfrey Network (OWN). Ngo-2013, uWinfrey wanikezwa uMongameli we-Freedom Medal nguMongameli U-Barack Obama.[16]

Ngo-2013, uWinfrey wanikezwa uMongameli we-Freedom Medal nguMongameli U-Barack Obama.[16]

english_source: The South African Broadcasting Corporation (SABC)[lower-alpha 1] is the public broadcaster in South Africa, and provides 19 radio stations (AM/FM) as well as six television broadcasts to the general public.[3] It is one of the largest of South Africa's state-owned enterprises.
target1_text: Inhlangano Yezokusakaza yaseNingizimu Afrika ( SABC ) [lower-alpha 1] ingumsakazeli womphakathi eNingizimu Afrika, futhi inikeza iziteshi zomsakazo eziyi-19 ( AM / FM ) kanye nemisakazo kamabonakude eyisithupha emphakathini jikelele. [1] Ingenye yezinkampani zikahulumeni ezinkulu kakhulu eNingizimu Afrika .
target2_text: Inhlangano Yezokusakaza yaseNingizimu Afrika (SABC) [lower-alpha 1]ingumsakazo womphakathi eNingizimu Afrika,futhi inikeza iziteshi zomsakazo eziyi-19 (AM / FM ) kanye nemisakazo kamabonakude eyisithupha emphakathini jikelele. [1] Ingenye yezinkampani zikahulumeni ezinkulu kakhulu eNingizimu Afrika .

english_source: An Afrikaner of Dutch and German ancestry,[2] Vosloo was born into a Pretoria acting family, his parents having been stage actors. His father ran a drive-in theater in Alberton, Gauteng. He has one sister. After high school and military service (from which he received a medical discharge),[3] he took drama courses at the Technikon Pretoria.[2]
target1_text: I-Afrikaner yozalo lwamaDashi namaJalimane, uVosloo wazalelwa emndenini wezemidlalo wasePitoli, abazali bakhe babengabadlali besiteji.[2] Uyise wayephethe inkundla yemidlalo yaseshashalazini e-Alberton, eGauteng. Unodadewabo oyedwa. Ngemva kwesikole esiphakeme nenkonzo yezempi (lapho athola khona ukukhishwa kwezokwelapha),[3] wathatha izifundo ze-drama e-I-Technikon Pretoria.[2]
target2_text: I-Afrikaner yozalo lwamaNgisi namaJalimane, uVosloo wazalelwa emndenini wezemidlalo wasePitoli, abazali bakhe babengabadlali basesiteji.[4] Ubaba wakhe wayephethe inkundla yemidlalo yshashalazini e-Alberton, eGauteng. Unodadewabo oyedwa. Ngemva kwesikole esiphakeme nenkonzo yezempi (lapho athola khona ukukhishwa kwezokwelapha),[5] wathatha izifundo ze-drama e-I-Technikon Pretoria.[4]

english_source: Nelson Makamo (February 1982) is a South African contemporary visual artist known for portraits often depicting rural South African children. Makamo has exhibited his work internationally, with notable solo shows in cities like Los Angeles, Paris, London, New York and in South Africa.[1][2]
target1_text: Nelson Makamo ( 1982) ungumdwebi wezithombe wesimanje waseNingizimu Afrika owaziwa ngezithombe ezivame ukubonisa izingane zasemaphandleni zaseNingizimu Afrika. UMakamo ukhangise umsebenzi wakhe emhlabeni wonke, ngemibukiso ephawulekayo emadolobheni anjengeLos Angeles, IParis, ILondon, INew York naseNingizimu Afrika.[1][2]
target2_text: UNelson Makamo (uFebruary 1982) ungumdwebi wezithombe wesimanje waseNingizimu Afrika owaziwa ngezithombe ezivame ukubonisa izingane zasemaphandleni zaseNingizimu Afrika. UMakamo ubonise umsebenzi wakhe emhlabeni wonke, ngemibukiso ephawulekayo emadolobheni anjengeLos Angeles, IParis, ILondon, INew York naseNingizimu Afrika.[1][2]

english_source: Makamo was born in Modimolle, Limpopo, South Africa, in February 1982, and his fascination with drawing began in childhood. He studied at the Artist Proof Studio in Johannesburg, where he specialized in printmaking.[3] This institution became a pivotal part of his journey, helping him develop a wide range of techniques, from charcoal sketches to oil and acrylic painting.
target1_text: uMakamo ungowesizwe samaTsonga kanti wazalelwa e-Modimolle, eLimpopo, eNingizimu Afrika, ngoFebhuwari 1982, futhi ukuthandwa kwakhe ukudweba kwaqala ebuntwaneni. Wafunda e-Artist Proof Studio eGoli, lapho afunda khona ngokunyathelisa.[1] Lesi sikhungo saba yingxenye ebalulekile yohambo lwakhe, samsiza ukuba asungule amasu ahlukahlukene, kusukela emidwebweni yamalahle kuya kumidwebo yamafutha ne-acrylic.
target2_text: UMakamo wazalelwa I-Modimolle, ULimpopo, eNingizimu Afrika, ngoFebhuwari 1982, futhi ukuthandwa kwakhe ukudweba kwaqala ebuntwaneni. Wafunda e-Artist Proof Studio eGoli, lapho afunda khona ngokunyathelisa.[1] Lesi sikhungo saba yingxenye ebalulekile yohambo lwakhe, samsiza ukuba asungule amasu ahlukahlukene, kusukela emidwebweni yamalahle kuya kumidwebo yamafutha ne-acrylic.

english_source: In 1953 the South African Apartheid government made attempts to persuade the people of Lusikisiki to accept the rule of Bantu authorities which they had established. The government worked with Paramount Chief King Botha Sigcau to attempt to start a rehabilitation scheme in Pondoland.[1] The scheme was presented to the Lusikisiki community but was rejected. A few days later, the police entered the area.[2] A man called Mngqinga led a large local group to attack the police. This was later known as the Lusikisiki Revolt.
target1_text: Ngo-1953 uhulumeni kaBandlululo waseNingizimu Afrika wenza imizamo yokuthonya AmaBantu baseLusikisiki ukuba bamukele ukubusa kweziphathimandla zaseBantu ababezimisile. Uhulumeni wasebenza neNkosi yeParamount uBotha Sigcau ukuzama ukuqala uhlelo lokuvuselela IPondoland.[1] Leli cebo lanikezwa umphakathi waseLusikisiki kodwa lenqatshwa. Ezinsukwini ezimbalwa kamuva, amaphoyisa angena endaweni.[2] Indoda okuthiwa uMngqinga yahola iqembu elikhulu lendawo ukuhlasela amaphoyisa. Lokhu kamuva kwaziwa ngokuthi yi-Lusikisiki Revolt.
target2_text: Ngo-1953 uhulumeni woBandlululo waseNingizimu Afrika wenza imizamo yokuthonya abantu baseLusikisiki ukuba bamukele ukubusa kweziphathimandla zaBantu ababezimisile. Uhulumeni wasebenza noNdunankulu uBotha Sigcau ukuzama ukuqala uhlelo lokuvuselela elamaMpondo.[1] Leli cebo lanikezwa umphakathi waseLusikisiki kodwa lenqatshwa. Ezinsukwini ezimbalwa kamuva, amaphoyisa angena endaweni.[2] Indoda okuthiwa uMngqinga yahola iqembu elikhulu lendawo ukuhlasela amaphoyisa. Lokhu kamuva kwaziwa ngokuthi i-Lusikisiki Revolt.

english_source: Voters consistently cited the economy as their top issue in the 2024 election.[1] Following the COVID-19 pandemic, a global surge in inflation ensued that raised prices on many goods, though the U.S. inflation rate had declined significantly during 2023 and 2024.[2][3][4] The New York Times reported that both candidates "embraced a vision of a powerful federal government, using its muscle to intervene in markets in pursuit of a stronger and more prosperous economy."[5]
target1_text: Abavoti baqhubeka becaphuna umnotho njengendaba yabo eyinhloko okhethweni luka-2024.[1] Ngemuva kobhadane lwe-COVID-19, kwalandela ukwanda kwamandla emali emhlabeni wonke okwenyusa amanani ezimpahla eziningi, yize izinga lokwehla kwamandla emala lase-US lalinciphe kakhulu phakathi kuka-2023 no-2024.[2][3][4] I-New York Times yabika ukuthi bobabili abakhethiwe "bamukela umbono kahulumeni wefederal onamandla, besebenzisa imisipha yayo ukungenela ezimakethe ekufuneni umnotho onamandla futhi ochumayo"[5]
target2_text: Abavoti babheke umnotho njengenkinga eyinhloko okhethweni luka-2024.[1] Ngemuva komqedazwe we-COVID-19, kwalandela ukwanda kwamandla emali emhlabeni wonke okwenyusa amanani ezimpahla eziningi, yize izinga lokwehla kwamandla emala lase-US lalinciphe kakhulu phakathi kuka-2023 no-2024.[2][3][4] I-New York Times yabika ukuthi bobabili abakhethiwe "bamukela umbono kahulumeni we-federali onamandla, osebenzisa amandla ayo ukungenela ezimakethe ekufuneni umnotho onamandla futhi ochumayo"[5]

english_source: The woodland gets its name from miombo (plural, singular muombo), the Bemba word for Brachystegia species. Other Bantu languages of the region, such as Swahili and Shona, have related if not identical words, such as Swahili miyombo (singular myombo). These woodlands are dominated by trees of subfamily Detarioideae, particularly miombo (Brachystegia), Julbernardia and Isoberlinia, which are rarely found outside miombo woodlands.[1]
target1_text: Ihlathi lithola igama layo ku-miyombo (ubuningi, i-muyombo eyodwa), igama lesiBemba elisho izinhlobo ze-Brachystegia . Ezinye izilimi zesiBantu zakulesi sifunda, njengesiSwahili nesiShona, zikhulume amagama afanayo, njengeSwahili miyombo ( i-myombo eyodwa ). Lezi zindawo zehlathi zigcwele izihlahla zomndeni omncane i-Detarioideae, ikakhulukazi i-miombo ( Brachystegia ), i-Julbernardia kanye ne-Isoberlinia, ezingavamile ukutholakala ngaphandle kwe-miombo woodlands. [1]
target2_text: Ihlathi lithola igama layo ku -miombo (ubuningi, i-muombo eyodwa), igama lesiBemba elisho izinhlobo ze -Brachystegia . Ezinye izilimi zesiBantu zakulesi sifunda, njengesiSwahili nesiShona, zikhulume amagama afanayo, njengeSwahili miyombo ( i-myombo eyodwa ). Lezi zindawo zehlathi zigcwele izihlahla zomndeni omncane i-Detarioideae, ikakhulukazi i-miombo ( Brachystegia ), i-Julbernardia kanye ne -Isoberlinia, ezingavamile ukutholakala ngaphandle kwe-miombo woodlands. english_source: SASSA was founded in 2005 to centralise the provision of social security assistance, formerly a primarily provincial function, in order to reduce corruption and improve service delivery.[4] It was closely modelled on its Australian counterpart, Centrelink.[4] Its key functions relate to the administration and payment of social grants, which support a large proportion of the South African population: in 2022, 46% of South Africans received a social grant.[5] SASSA's functions including processing applications for social security assistance, verifying and approving applications, disbursing and paying the grants to eligible beneficiaries, and preventing and detecting fraud.[3] SASSA employs biometric technology, including fingerprint and facial recognition, to verify the identity of beneficiaries. This helps ensure that the grants reach the intended recipients and reduce the risk of identity theft and fraud.
target1_text: I-SASSA yasungulwa ngo-2005 ukuze ihlanganise ukuhlinzekwa kosizo lwezokuphepha komphakathi, ngaphambili umsebenzi oyinhloko isifundazwe, ukuze kuncishiswe inkohlakalo futhi kuthuthukiswe ukulethwa kwezinsizakalo. Yayilingisa eduze nomlingani wayo wase-Australia, i-Centrelink. Imisebenzi yayo eyinhloko iphathelene nokuphatha nokukhokha izibonelelo zomphakathi, ezisekela ingxenye enkulu yabantu baseNingizimu Afrika: ngo-2022, u-46% wabantu baseNingizimu Afrika bathola izibonelelo zezenhlalo. Imisebenzi ye-SASSA ihlanganisa ukucubungula izicelo zosizo lwezokuphepha komphakathi, ukuqinisekisa nokwamukela izicelo, ukukhokhela nokukhokhela izibonelelo kubazuzi abafanele, nokuvimbela nokuthungatha Ukukhwabanisa. I-SASSA isebenzisa ubuchwepheshe be-biometric, kufaka phakathi iminwe kanye nokuqashelwa kobuso, ukuqinisekisa ukuthi bangobani abazuzi. Lokhu kusiza ekuqinisekiseni ukuthi izibonelelo zifinyelela kulabo abahlosiwe futhi kunciphise ingozi yokwebiwa kwemininingwane nokukhwabanisa.

Lokhu kusiza ekuqinisekiseni ukuthi izibonelelo zifinyelela kulabo abahlosiwe futhi kunciphise ingozi yokwebiwa kwemininingwane nokukhwabanisa.

english_source: In October 2024, 2 Stellenbosch University students came forward claiming that there was mass fraud among the youths ID numbers which were being used to collect SASSA SRD R370 grants.[29][30]

english_source: The Republic of South Africa Constitution Act, 1983, again approved by a whites-only referendum, created the Tricameral Parliament, with separate houses representing Whites, Coloureds and Indians but without representation for Blacks. The figurehead State President and executive Prime Minister were merged into an executive State President, chosen by parliament. This characteristic remains to date and is nearly unique to South Africa (one exception being neighbouring Botswana).
target1_text: I-Republic of South Africa Constitution Act, ka-1983, iphinde yamukelwa yi-referendum yAbamhlophe kuphela, yasungula iPhalamende le-Tricameral, nezindlu ezihlukene ezimele abamhlophe, abansundu nAmaNdiya kodwa ngaphandle kokumelwa kwabansundu. Umongameli wezwe oyinhloko kanye UNdunankulu ophethe bahlanganiswa baba nguMongameli ophethe wezwe, okhethwe yiphalamende. Lesi sici sisekhona kuze kube namuhla futhi sicishe siyingqayizivele eNingizimu Afrika (okunye ngaphandle kweBotswana engumakhelwane).
target2_text: I-Republic of South Africa Constitution Act, ka-1983, iphinde yamukelwa yi-referendum yabamhlophe kuphela, yasungula iPhalamende le-Tricameral, nezindlu ezihlukene ezimele abamhlophe, amaKhaladi namaNdiya kodwa ngaphandle kokumelwa kwabamnyama. UMongameli weZwe oyinhloko kanye noNdunankulu ophethe kwahlanganiswa kwaba nguMongameli ophethe wezwe, okhethwe yiphalamende. Lesi sici sisekhona kuze kube namuhla futhi cishe siyingqayizivele eNingizimu Afrika (ngaphandle kweBotswana engumakhelwane).

english_source: An integral part of the negotiations to end apartheid in South Africa was the creation of a new constitution. One of the major disputed issues was the process by which such a constitution would be adopted. The African National Congress (ANC) insisted that it should be drawn up by a democratically elected constituent assembly, while the governing National Party (NP) feared that the rights of minorities would not be protected in such a process, and proposed instead that the constitution be negotiated by consensus between the parties and then put to a referendum.[1][2]
target1_text: Ingxenye ebalulekile izingxoxo zokuqeda ubandlululo eNingizimu Afrika kwakuwukwakhiwa komthethosisekelo omusha. Enye yezinkinga ezinkulu eziphikiswana ngazo kwakuyinqubo lapho umthetho-sisekelo onjalo wawuzokwamukelwa khona. I-African National Congress (ANC) yaphikelela ngokuthi kufanele ibhalwe ngumhlangano womthethosisekelo okhethwe ngentando yeningi, kuyilapho i-National Party (NP) ebusayo yayesaba ukuthi amalungelo amaqembu amancane ngeke avikelwe kulenqubo enjalo, futhi yahlongoza ukuthi esikhundleni salokho umthetho-sisekelo kufanele uxoxiswane ngokuvumelana phakathi kwamaqembu bese ufakwa ku-referendum. [1][2]
target2_text: Ingxenye ebalulekile yezingxoxo zokuqeda ubandlululo eNingizimu Afrika kwakuwukwakhiwa komthethosisekelo omusha. Enye yezinkinga ezinkulu okwakuphikiswana ngazo kwakuyinqubo lapho umthetho-sisekelo onjalo owawuzokwamukelwa ngayo. I-African National Congress (ANC) yaphikelela ngokuthi kufanele ibhalwe yibutho lomthethosisekelo elikhethwe ngentando yeningi, kuyilapho i-National Party (NP) ebusayo yayesaba ukuthi amalungelo amaqembu amancane ngeke avikelwe kulenqubo enjalo, futhi yahlongoza ukuthi esikhundleni salokho umthetho-sisekelo kufanele uxoxiswane ngokuvumelana phakathi kwamaqembu bese ufakwa ku-referendum. [1][2]

english_source: Disciplines vary between well-established ones in almost all universities with well-defined rosters of journals and conferences and nascent ones supported by only a few universities and publications. A discipline may have branches, which are often called sub-disciplines.
target1_text: Iziyalo ziyahlukahluka phakathi kwalezo ezisungulwe kahle cishe kuwo wonke amanyuvesi anezinhlu ezichazwe kahle zamajenali nezinkomfa kanye nalezo ezisafufusa ezisekelwa amanyuvesi ambalwa kuphela nokushicilelwe. Isiyalo singaba namagatsha, avame ukubizwa ngokuthi ama-sub-disciplines.

english_source: With a listenership of over 7.5 million, Ukhozi FM has been and is more than a radio station; it is a reflector, a self-standing testimony to the many lives that have been and are being lived here. Ukhozi FM is still the home of 7.9 million isiZulu speakers, who tune into the station every day to be informed, educated and entertained in their home language.
target1_text: Ngabantu abangaphezu kwezigidi ezingu-7.5, i-Ukhozi FM ibilokhu ingeyona futhi ingeyona nje isiteshi somsakazo; iyisibonakaliso, ubufakazi obuzimele bezimpilo eziningi ezake zaba khona futhi eziphila lapha.I-Ukhozi FM iseyikhaya lezikhulumi eziyizigidi ezingu-7.9 ze-isiZulu, ezilalela isiteshi nsuku zonke ukuze zishizwe, zifundwe futhi zijabulwe ngolimi lwendabuko.

english_source: The University of Limpopo (Afrikaans: Universiteit van Limpopo) is a public university in the Limpopo Province, South Africa. It was formed on 1 January 2005, by merger of the University of the North and the Medical University of South Africa (MEDUNSA).[2] These previous institutions formed the Turfloop and MEDUNSA campuses of the university, respectively. In 2015 the MEDUNSA campus split and became the Sefako Makgatho Health Sciences University.[3]
target1_text: Inyuvesi yaseLimpopo (Afrikaans: Universiteit van Limpopo) inyuvesi yomphakathi esifundazweni saseLimpopo, INingizimu Afrika. Yakhiwa ngo-1 January 2005, ngokuhlangana kwe-University of the North ne-Medical University of South Africa (MEDUNSA).[1] Lezi zikhungo zangaphambili zakha amakamu e-I-Turfloop ne-MEDUNSA eyunivesithi, ngokulandelana. Ngo-2015 ikamu le-MEDUNSA lahlukana laba yi-ISefako Makgatho Health Sciences University.[2]
target2_text: I-University of Limpopo (Afrikaans: Universiteit van Limpopo) eyunivesithi yomphakathi esifundazweni saseLimpopo, INingizimu Afrika. Yakhiwa ngo-1 January 2005, ngokuhlangana kwe-University of the North ne-Medical University of South Africa (MEDUNSA).[1] Lezi zikhungo zangaphambili zakha amakamu e-I-Turfloop ne-MEDUNSA eyunivesithi, ngokulandelana. Ngo-2015 ikamu le-MEDUNSA lahlukana laba yi-ISefako Makgatho Health Sciences University.[2]

english_source: Culture is a term that is highly complex and often contested with academics recording about 160 variations in meaning. Underpinning the notion of culture is that it is dynamic and changes over time and in different contexts resulting in many people today identifying with one or more cultures and many different ways.

english_source: The ocean is the body of salt water that covers approximately 70.8% of Earth.[1] The ocean is conventionally divided into large bodies of water, which are also referred to as oceans (the Pacific, Atlantic, Indian, Antarctic/Southern, and Arctic Ocean)[2][3],[4] and are themselves mostly divided into seas, gulfs and subsequent bodies of water. The ocean contains 97% of Earth's water[1] and is the primary component of Earth's hydrosphere, acting as a huge reservoir of heat for Earth's energy budget, as well as for its carbon cycle and water cycle, forming the basis for climate and weather patterns worldwide. The ocean is essential to life on Earth, harbouring most of Earth's animals and protist life,[5] originating photosynthesis and therefore Earth's atmospheric oxygen, still supplying half of it.[6]
target1_text: Ulwandle umzimba wamanzi anosawoti ahlanganisa cishe u-70.8% woMhlaba . [ 1 ]
target2_text: Ulwandlekazi yindikimba yamanzi anetswayi ehlanganisa cishe amaphesenti angama-70.8% woMhlaba . [1]

english_source: The primary purpose of evaluation, in addition to gaining insight into prior or existing initiatives, is to enable reflection and assist in the identification of future change.[1] Evaluation is often used to characterize and appraise subjects of interest in a wide range of human enterprises, including the arts, criminal justice, foundations, non-profit organizations, government, health care, and other human services. It is long term and done at the end of a period of time.
target1_text: Inhloso eyinhloko yokuhlola, ngaphezu kokuthola ukuqonda mayelana nezinhlelo zangaphambilini noma ezikhona, ukunika amandla ukuzindla nokusiza ekuhlonzeni ushintsho lwesikhathi esizayo. [ 1 ] Ukuhlola kuvame ukusetshenziselwa ukuveza nokulinganisa izihloko ezinentshisekelo kuzo ezinhlobonhlobo zezinkampani zabantu, okuhlanganisa ezobuciko, ubulungiswa bobugebengu, izisekelo, izinhlangano ezingenzi nzuzo, uhulumeni, ukunakekelwa kwezempilo, nezinye izinsiza zabantu.

[1] Ukucubungula kuvame ukusetshenziselwa ukuveza nokulinganisa izihloko ezithakaselwayo kuzo ezinhlobonhlobo zemikhakha yabantu, okuhlanganisa ezobuciko, ubulungiswa bobugebengu, izisekelo, izinhlangano ezingenzi nzuzo, uhulumeni, ukunakekelwa kwezempilo, nezinye izinsiza zabantu.

english_source: Central government revenues come primarily from income tax, value added tax (VAT) and corporation tax. Local government revenues come primarily from grants from central government funds and municipal rates. In the 2018/19 fiscal year SARS collected R 1 287.7 billion (equivalent to US$ 86.4 billion)[5] in tax revenue, a figure R71.2 billion (or 5.8%) more than that from the previous fiscal year.
target1_text: Imali engenayo kahulumeni oyinhloko ivela enteleni yemali engenayo, intela ye-value added (VAT) intela yenkampani. Imali engenayo kahulumeni wendawo ivela ngokuyinhloko ezibonelweni ezivela ezikhwameni zikahulumeni oyinhloko kanye nezinga lamasipala. Ngonyaka wezezimali we-2018/19, i-SAR yaqoqa ama-R 1 287.7 billion (elingana nama-US $ 86.4 billion) emalini engenayo yentela, isibalo sama-R71.2 billion (noma ama-5.8%) ngaphezulu kunaleso sonyaka wezezimali odlule.[5]
target2_text: Izimali ezingenayo kahulumeni omkhulu zivela enteleni yemali yomholo, intela ye-value added (VAT) kanye nentela yenkampani. Imali engenayo kahulumeni wendawo ivela ngokuyinhloko ezibonelweni ezivela ezikhwameni zikahulumeni oyinhloko kanye nezinga lamasipala. english_source: Herbert Baker, among the country's most influential architects, designed the Union Buildings in Pretoria. Other buildings of note include the Rhodes memorial and St George's Cathedral in Cape Town, and St John's College in Johannesburg.
target1_text: UHerbert Baker, phakathi kwabaklami bezakhiwo abanethonya kakhulu ezweni, waklama izakhiwo ze-Union ePitoli. Ezinye izakhiwo eziphawulekayo zihlanganisa Isikhumbuzo saseRhodes kanye neSt George's Cathedral IKapa, kanye neSt John's College IGoli.
target2_text: UHerbert Baker, phakathi kwabaklami bezakhiwo abanomthelela kakhulu ezweni, waklama izakhiwo ze-Union ePitoli. Ezinye izakhiwo eziphawulekayo zihlanganisa Isikhumbuzo saseRhodes kanye neSt George's Cathedral IKapa, kanye neSt John's College esiseGoli.

english_source: Notable white English-language South African authors include Nadine Gordimer who was, in Seamus Heaney's words, one of "the guerrillas of the imagination", and who became the first South African and the seventh woman to be awarded the Nobel Prize for Literature in 1991. Her novel, July's People, was released in 1981, depicting the collapse of white-minority rule.
target1_text: Ababhali baseNingizimu Afrika abavelele abakhuluma isiNgisi bahlanganisa uNadine Gordimer, owayengomunye "wezempi zokucabanga", futhi owaba ngowokuqala waseNingizimu Afrika nowesifazane wesikhombisa owanikezwa Umklomelo kaNobel Wezincwadi ngo-1991. Inoveli yakhe, i-July's People, yakhululwa ngo-1981, iveza ukuwa kokubusa kweqembu elincane labamhlophe.

Inoveli yakhe, i-July's People, yakhululwa ngo-1981, iveza ukuwa kokubusa kweqembu elincane labamhlophe.

english_source: Alan Paton published the acclaimed novel Cry, the Beloved Country in 1948. He told the tale of a black priest who comes to Johannesburg to find his son, which became an international best-seller. During the 1950s, Drum magazine became a hotbed of political satire, fiction, and essays, giving a voice to urban black culture.
target1_text: U-Alan Paton wanyathelisa inoveli edumile ethi Cry, the Beloved Country ngo-1948. Watshela indaba yompristi omnyama oweza IGoli ukuyofuna indodana yakhe, eyaba incwadi ethengiswa kakhulu emhlabeni wonke. Phakathi nawo-1950, umagazini i-Drum waba yindawo eyinhloko yokuhlazisa kwezombusazwe, izindaba eziqanjiwe, nezindaba, ezinikeza izwi lesiko labamnyama basemadolobheni.
target2_text: U-Alan Paton washicilela inoveli edumile ethi Cry, the Beloved Country ngo-1948. Wadlulisa indaba yompristi omnyama oweza eGoli ukuyofuna indodana yakhe, okwaba incwadi ethengiswa kakhulu emhlabeni wonke. Phakathi nawo-1950, umagazini i-Drum waba yindawo eyinhloko yokuhlazisa kwezombusazwe, izindaba eziqanjiwe, nezindaba, ezinikeza izwi lesiko labamnyama basemadolobheni.

english_source: Helichrysum petiolare, the licorice-plant[1] or liquorice plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is a subshrub native to the Cape Provinces of South Africa — where it is known as imphepho — and to Angola, Zambia, and Zimbabwe.[2] It is naturalized in parts of Portugal and the United States.[3] Growing to about 45 cm (18 in) high and 150 cm (59 in) broad, it is a trailing evergreen subshrub with furry grey-green leaves and small white flowers.[4] Other common names include silver-bush everlastingflower,[5] trailing dusty miller and kooigoed. The foliage has a faint licorice aroma,[6] but Helichrysum petiolare is not closely related to true liquorice, Glycyrrhiza glabra, from which liquorice candy is made.
target1_text: I-Helichrysum petiolare, isitshalo se-licorice [1] noma isitshalo se-liquorice, iwuhlobo lwesitshalo esiqhakaza emndenini wakwa -Asteraceae . Itholakala ezifundazweni zaseKapa eNingizimu Afrika - lapho yaziwa khona ngokuthi i-imphepho - kanye nase-Angola, Zambia, naseZimbabwe. [ 2 ] Kwenziwa ngokwemvelo ezingxenyeni ezithile zasePortugal nase-United States. [3] Ikhula cishe 45 cm (18 in) phezulu futhi 150 cm (59 in) ububanzi, iyisihlahla esilandelanayo esihlala siluhlaza esinamaqabunga anoboya obumpunga nezimbali ezincane ezimhlophe kakhulu. [4] Amanye amagama ajwayelekile ahlanganisa i-silver-bush everlastingflower, [5] i-trailing miller enothuli kanye ne -kooigoed . Amahlamvu anephunga elimnandi le-licorice, [6] kodwa i-Helichrysum petiolare ayihlobene eduze nogologo wangempela, i-Glycyrrhiza glabra, okwenziwa ngayo uswidi we-liquorice .
target2_text: I-Helichrysum petiolare, isitshalo se-licorice [ 1 ] noma isitshalo se-liquorice, iwuhlobo lwesitshalo esiqhakaza emndenini wakwa -Asteraceae . Itholakala ezifundazweni zaseKapa eNingizimu Afrika - lapho yaziwa khona ngokuthi i-imphepho - kanye nase-Angola, Zambia, naseZimbabwe. [ 2 ] Kwenziwa ngokwemvelo ezingxenyeni ezithile zasePortugal nase-United States. [ 3 ] Ikhula cishe 45 cm (18 in) phezulu futhi 150 cm (59 in) ububanzi, iyisihlahla esilandelanayo esihlala siluhlaza esinamaqabunga anoboya obumpunga nezimbali ezincane ezimhlophe. [ 4 ] Amanye amagama ajwayelekile ahlanganisa i-silver-bush everlastingflower, [ 5 ] i-trailing miller enothuli kanye ne -kooigoed . Amahlamvu anephunga elimnandi le-licorice, [ 6 ] kodwa i-Helichrysum petiolare ayihlobene eduze nogologo wangempela, i-Glycyrrhiza glabra, okwenziwa ngayo uswidi we-liquorice .

english_source: During fellatio, a partner may ingest semen from the penis. As late as 1976, some doctors were advising women in the eighth and ninth months of pregnancy not to swallow semen lest it induce premature labor, but it was later determined to be safe.[1]

english_source: Griffiths Mlungisi Mxenge was the eldest son of Johnson Pinti and Hannah Nowise Mxenge. His parents were farmers in KwaRayi. He began his high schooling at Forbes Grant Secondary school in Ginsberg but matriculated from Newell High school in Port Elizabeth in 1956.[1]

Catalogue published in conjunction with the exhibition. Mason's artist's books were showcased in Washington DC at the National Museum for African Art for the 'Artists' Books and Africa' exhibition ended 11 September 2016. 'Undiscovered Animals' June 2016 was her final exhibition.

english_source: Her major public commissions include: The Man Who Sang and The Woman Who Kept Silent aka The Blue Dress at the Constitutional Court in Johannesburg, South Africa. Several large tapestries in collaboration with Marguerite Stephens and stained-glass window designs for the Great Park Synagogue in Johannesburg. In 2008, from 2 October to 6 December 2008, the Standard Bank Gallery in Johannesburg, South Africa hosted a major retrospective of paintings, drawings, assemblage, installations, artists books and essays. Sasol Art Museum at the University of Stellenbosch installed the same retrospective titled: A Prospect of Icons from 14 January to 28 March 2009. Her first solo exhibition was at Gallery 101, Johannesburg, in 1964 after winning second prize in the U.A.T competition in 1963. Mason has exhibited regularly in Johannesburg, Cape Town, Pretoria, Stellenbosch, Mpumalanga and George. Goodman Gallery, Chelsea Gallery, Association of Arts Pretoria, Association of Arts Cape Town, Hout Street Gallery, Strydom Gallery, Dorp Street Gallery, Art on Paper, Abalone Gallery, Sasol Art Museum, University of Stellenbosch, Standard Bank Museum, Karen Mackerron Gallery, as well as lithographs, oil paintings and drawings at Ombondi Gallery in New York in 1990 and more recently, tapestries, paintings and drawings at the Deering Estate, Miami Dade, 2016 and lithographs at Art Basel Miami Beach 2010 and 2015. She represented South Africa at the Venice Biennale, 1986, São Paulo Biennale 1973, Brazil, Valparaiso Biennale 1979, Chile and Houston Arts Festival 1980, USA.
target1_text: Amakhomishini akhe amakhulu abandakanya umphakathi yi: The Man Who Sang and The Woman Who Kept Silent aka The Blue dress enkantolo yezomthethosisekelo eGoli, South Africa. Amapayipi amakhulu amaningi ngokubambisana neMarguerite Stephens kanye nemiklamo yamawindi enziwe ngengilazi yeGreat Park Synagogue eGoli . Ngo-2008, kusukela mhlaka 2 Okthoba kuya kumhlaka 6 Disemba 2008, iStandard Bank Gallery eJohannesburg, eNingizimu Afrika kwaba nomcimbi omkhulu wokuphinda upende, ukudweba, ukuhlangana, ukufakwa, izincwadi zabadwebi nezindatshana. ISasol Art Museum eNyuvesi yaseStellenbosch yafaka okufanayo okusobala: I-Prospect of Icons ukusuka ngomhlaka 14 kuJanuwari kuya kumhla zingama-28 kuNdasa wezi-2009. Umbukiso wakhe wokuqala wawuseGalari 101, eGoli, ngo-1964 ngemuva kokuthola umklomelo wesibili emncintiswaneni we-UAT ngo-1963. UMason uveze njalo eGoli, eKapa, ePitoli, eStellenbosch, eMpumalanga naseGeorge. Igalari yaseGoodman, igalari yaseChelsea, i-Association of Arts ePitoli, i-Hout Street Gallery, i-Strydom Gallery, iDorp Street Gallery, ubuciko obusePhepha, Igalari ye-Abalone, iSasol Art Museum, i-University of Stellenbosch, i-Standard Bank Museum, uKaren Mackerron Gallery, kanye nama -graphicgraphic, imidwebo kawoyela nemidwebo e-Ombondi Gallery eNew York ngonyaka ka-1990 nangamuva nje, ama-tapestries, imidwebo nemidwebo eDeering Estate, eMiami Dade, ngo-2016 nakwizindikimba e-Art Basel Miami Beach 2010 nango-2015. I-Africa eVenice Biennale, 1986, São Paulo Biennale 1973, eBrazil, uValparaiso Biennale 1979, eChile kanye neHouston Arts Festival 1980, e-USA.

english_source: Judith Mason born Judith Seelander Menge (10 October 1938 Pretoria – 28 December 2016 White River) was a South African artist who worked in oil, pencil, printmaking and mixed media. Her work is rich in symbolism and mythology, displaying a rare technical virtuosity.
target1_text: UJudith Mason owazalwa uJudith Seelander Menge (10 Okthoba 1938 Pretoria - 28 KUZibandlela 2016 White River) wayengumculi waseNingizimu Afrika obesebenza kwezamafutha, ipensela, ukuprinta ukushicilela nezindaba ezixubile. Umsebenzi wakhe ucebile ngokufanekisela kanye ne-mythology, ekhombisa ubuciko obunqabile bobucwepheshe.

Umsebenzi wakhe ucebile ngokufanekisela kanye ne-mythology, ekhombisa ubuciko obunqabile bobuchwepheshe.

english_source: Judith Mason was born in Pretoria; South Africa, in 1938. She matriculated at the Pretoria High School for Girls in 1956. In 1960, she was awarded a BA Degree in Fine Arts at the University of the Witwatersrand. She taught painting at the University of the Witwatersrand, the University of Pretoria, the Michaelis School of Fine Art in Cape Town, Scuola Lorenzo de' Medici in Florence, Italy from 1989 to 1991 and acted as external examiner for under-graduate and post-graduate degrees at Pretoria, Potchefstroom, Natal, Stellenbosch and Cape Town Universities. Several of Mason's works deal with the atrocities uncovered by the Truth and Reconciliation Commission.[1] Mason died in White River 28 December 2016.[2]
target1_text: UJudith Mason wazalelwa ePitoli; eNingizimu Afrika, ngonyaka ka-1938. Ufunde umatikuletsheni ePitoli High School for Girls ngo-1956. Ngo-1960, wanikezwa i-BA Degree in Fine Arts e- University of Witwatersrand . Ufundise ukudweba eNyuvesi yaseWitwatersrand, eNyuvesi yasePitoli, iMichaelis School of Fine Art eKapa, Scuola Lorenzo de 'Medici eFlorence, e-Italy kusuka ngo-1989 kuya ku-1991 futhi wasebenza njengomhloli wangaphandle wabafundi abangaphothula iziqu kanye nabasebenza ngemuva iziqu ezithweswe iziqu ePitoli, Potchefstrom, Natali, Stellenbosch naseCape Town University . Imisebenzi eminingana kaMason ibhekana nezenzo ezimbi ezembulwe yiKhomishini yeqiniso nokubuyisana . [1] UMason ushone eWhite River 28 kuZibandlela 2016. [2]

english_source: Pitika Ntuli is an expert in African indigenous knowledge systems. He is a regular political and cultural commentator on TV and Radio. He is a well-known poet and speaker who has been a keynote speaker at numerous high-profile events and has read his poetry in many forums in the country and the Region.He is a frequent guest on TV and Radio and especially on many of the SABC African Language Radio stations, and has also participated in several national and provincial task teams and ministerial advisory committees.
target1_text: UPitika Ntuli ungcweti ezinhlelweni zolwazi lwendabuko zase-Afrika. Ungumhlaziyi ojwayelekile wezepolitiki nosiko ku-TV nakuRadio. Ungumbongi nosomlomo owaziwayo obekade eyisikhulumi esiphambili emicimbini eminingi ephakeme kakhulu futhi ufunde izinkondlo zakhe ezinhlanganweni eziningi zezwe naseSifundeni. Uyisimenywa esivamile kuTV nakuRadio futhi ikakhulukazi emicimbini eminingi iziteshi zakwa-SABC zase-Afrika Zomsakazo, futhi futhi ubambe iqhaza emaqenjini emisebenzi kazwelonke neyezifundazwe kanye namakomidi okululeka ongqongqoshe.

english_source: Dumas paintings are seen as portraits but they do not represent people but an emotional state that one could be in. Her art focuses on more serious issues and themes such as sexuality and race, guilt and innocence, violence and tenderness.[5] Dumas style is more older romanticism tradition. She uses loose brushstrokes to add distortion but also great detail to her art. [6]
target1_text: Imidwebo yeDumas ibonwa njengezithombe kepha ayimeleli abantu kepha isimo esingokomzwelo umuntu angaba kuso. Ubuciko bakhe bugxile ezindabeni ezibucayi nakwizindikimba ezinjengobulili nezobuhlanga, umuzwa wecala nobumsulwa, udlame nobumnene. [1] Isitayela seDumas yisiko lakudala kakhulu lothando. Usebenzisa ama-brashi ama-brushings okungeziwe ukungeza ukuhlanekezela kepha nemininingwane enhle kubuciko bakhe. [2]

english_source: The hearing took place on 9 February 2016.[28] At it, Zuma's counsel, Jeremy Gauntlett SC, made a series of major concessions, including that the Nkandla report was binding on Zuma, but asked the Court not to declare that Zuma had acted unconstitutionally.[28] The issue was significant because such a declaration would be a basis for Zuma's impeachment.[28] Zuma's strategy was perceived as an attempt to evade responsibility and throw his ministers under the bus.[28][29] Minister Nhleko's legal team, in turn, said his "hands were tied" because he was following instructions from Zuma and the National Assembly.[29] Only Speaker Baleka Mbete's counsel, Lindi Nkosi-Thomas SC, seriously disputed the EFF and DA's account of the facts and law, but was ultimately forced to capitulate and was widely mocked for her "bumbling" performance.[29][30]

[1] Udaba lolu belubalulekile ngoba isimemezelo esinjalo bekuzoba yisisekelo sokufakwa kukaZuma. [1] Isu likaZuma lithathwe njengemizamo yokugwema umthwalo wemfanelo nokujikisa ongqongqoshe bakhe ngaphansi kwebhasi. [1] [2] Ithimba lezomthetho likaNgqongqoshe uNhleko naye uthe "izandla zakhe ziboshwe" ngoba elandela imiyalo evela kuZuma kanye neNdlu Kazwelonke. [2] Iseluleko sikaSomlomo uBaleka Mbete kuphela, uLindi Lord-Thomas SC, siphikise kakhulu i-akhawunti ye-EFF ne-DA ngamaqiniso nomthetho, kodwa ekugcineni waphoqeleka ukuba abambe iqhaza futhi wagconwa kakhulu ngokusebenza kwakhe "ngokuxhamazela". english_source: But the ANC continued to support Zuma. The ANC Women's League had released a statement hours after the judgment saying its faith in Zuma "remains unshaken".[57][58] Secretary-General Gwede Mantashe, speaking on behalf of the so-called Top Six, said he "welcomed" Zuma's apologetic statement but that calls for his impeachment were "over-exaggerated".[59][60] Chief whip Jackson Mthembu and Deputy Minister of Justice John Jeffery took the view that, although Zuma had breached the Constitution, the breach was not "serious".[61][62] The impeachment bid by opposition MPs on 5 April 2016 failed by over 120 votes.[62] Some were surprised that even Zuma's opponents within the ANC like Cyril Ramaphosa and Pravin Gordhan had voted against the motion.[7][64] The Congress of the People, an opposition party, said it would boycott parliamentary proceedings in light of the National Assembly's failure to implement the Court's judgment.[65]
target1_text: Kepha i-ANC yaqhubeka nokweseka uZuma. Uphiko lwabesifazane lwe-ANC selukhiphe isitatimende ngemuva kwezinsolo ezithi isahlulelo sokholo lwaso kuZuma "sisalokhu singakashiswa". [1] [2] UNobhala-Jikelele uGwede Mantashe, ekhuluma egameni lele ndawo ebizwa ngokuthi yiTop six, uthe uyakwamukela lokho okushiwo nguZuma ngokuxolisa kodwa okufuna ukuthi icala lakhe ligasele. [3] [4] Isilobe esikhulu uJackson Mthembu kanye nePhini likaNgqongqoshe Wezobulungiswa uJohn Jeffery bathathe umbono wokuthi yize uZuma ephule uMthethosisekelo, ukwephula umthetho kwakungeyona into ebucayi. [5] [6] Imibhikisho yokuthathwa kwezikhundla ngamalungu e-MP aphikisayo mhlaka 5 Ephreli 2016 yehlulekile ngamavoti angaphezu kuka-120. [6] Abanye bamangele ukuthi ngisho nabaphikisi bakaZuma ngaphakathi ku-ANC Cyril Ramaphosa, Pravin Gordhan bavote ngalesisenzo.
